text: JJ ancient mysteries are waiting to be unraveled this century , as NN and technology continue to advance . Seen as the “ JJ age of exploration ” , the 21st century promises to solve some of the most intriguing puzzles of our current history . NNS are still discussing the purpose of the Nazca lines . Do these complex geoglyphs in Peru symbolize constellations ? Are they compared to giant alien landing spots , or are these signs showing the NN for their ships ? For now , no NN seems plausible enough when it comes to explaining their purpose . These are the famous Nazca lines , a mystery that has concerned countless researchers for over 80 NNS . These mysterious markings were built on the ground , but can only be seen from above . It ’s worth mentioning that the area is mostly JJ and cannot offer a higher view of the glyphs . The Nazca Lines can be VBN in the Nazca Desert , a barren plateau that expands between the city of Nasca and Palpa on the pampa , which is a smooth , desolated area of southern Peru . They cover - up an era of desert of nearly 400 square NNS . Overall , there are more than 800 successive lines , 300 geometric figures and 70 animal and plant designs . Some of the straight lines stretch over 30 NNS , while the other designs range from 50 to 1,200 NNS in length , being as JJ as the Empire NNP Building . Enormous geoglyphs are VBN in other places on NNP , such as Egypt , Chile , Bolivia , the NNP NNPS ( Mississippi and California ) , Malta and in other NNS . However , the Nazca geoglyphs form an impressive and mysterious archaeological group because of their number , range , typical features as well as cultural continuity and preservation over the centuries . The Nazca plain is remarkable for its ability to maintain the markings intact over a JJ period of NN . Because the NN is CD of the driest on NNP , recording only twenty minutes of rainfall each NN , and the rocky soil which reduces the effect of wind at ground level , this barren place is ideal for preserving a work of art for eternity . The clarity and positioning of the lines and drawings leave no doubt that an exhaustive and JJ - term effort was instrumental in their creation . There are diverse designs consisting of shapes of animals , plants , objects , flowers , and RB huge manlike figures made with well - defined lines . The most renowned drawing is of a weird being looking similar to an astronaut . Measuring close to 100 NNS in length , it was discovered by Maria Reiche in the 1960’s . Another curious representation is of a strange being with CD huge , monstrous hands , CD of them possessing only four fingers . South of the Nazca Lines , on the pampa , archaeologists have discovered the ancient city of the line - builders – Cahuachi . It was constructed almost CD thousand NNS ago and was inexplicably deserted 500 NNS later . Recent findings at Cahuachi are starting to slowly blow the dust off this ancient mystery . Italian researcher Giuseppe Orefici has been uncovering the site ’s secrets for the past decades , bringing a team down each NN . He concluded that the settlement ’s population was quite JJ , but the city was RB a pilgrimage center that brought a huge increase in population whenever ceremonial events occurred . These events seemingly concerned the Nazca Lines and the colossal sand dune of Nasca . This NN seems very plausible because of the archaeological NN provided by the Nazca lines , showing creatures such as a killer whales and monkeys , which did not exist in the Nazca region . Because of the arid NN the recent findings consist of clothing and amazingly preserved mummified bodies of the Nazca NNS . text: HOLLYWOOD ( CNN ) -- Any student of Shakespeare MD have VBN " Xena , Warrior Princess " fans what was VBG to happen to Julius Caesar in last season 's cliffhanger episode , " The Ides of March . text: On February 3 , 1851 , a 32 - NN - old Frenchman — who ’d dropped out of JJ school and dabbled in photography — definitively demonstrated that the NNP indeed rotated , surprising the Parisian scientific establishment . Acting on a hunch , Léon Foucault had determined that he MD use a pendulum to illustrate the effect of the NNP ’s movement . He called together a group of NNS , enticing them with a note declaring , “ You are invited to VB the NNP turn . ” Foucault hung a pendulum from the ceiling of the Meridian Room of the Paris Observatory . As it swept through the air , it traced a pattern that effectively proved the NN was spinning about an axis . A month later , Foucault shared his experiment with all of Paris at the majestic Pantheon building . According to the NNP Physical Society , he suspended from the Pantheon ’s lofty dome a 61 - pound brass bob on a 220 - NN cable . As it swung back and forth , the pointed end of the bob traced lines in sand that had been poured on a wooden platform . Over NN , the angle of these lines changed , suggesting to audience members that the direction of the pendulum ’s travel was shifting under the influence of an unperceived rotational motion — that of NNP . Foucault was able to demonstrate a scientific concept in a NN that the average person MD easily grasp , VBZ Rebecca C. Thompson , head of JJ outreach for the APS . For centuries , it was a commonly held belief that the NNP rotated on an axis . But it was Foucault who dispelled lingering doubts once and for all , establishing the phenomenon firmly in the realm of fact . “ It RB started the cultural shift to fundamentally understanding our universe differently , ” Thompson VBZ . The experiment was a hit , drawing flocks of fascinated Parisians and catapulting Foucault to fame . Pendulums VBN on Foucault ’s calculations began appearing worldwide — and are still iconic features of JJ NN museums in the U.S. and other NNS . The Smithsonian Institution made a pendulum a focal point of its Museum of History and Technology ( which later became the National Museum of NNP History ) . The building — which opened in 1964 on the National Mall in NNP , D.C. — was designed purposely to accommodate a pendulum . It hung from the ceiling of the third floor and stretched 71 NNS through the center of the building , where it swung slowly and rhythmically across a fancifully emblazoned circle on the JJ floor . The Smithsonian pendulum was intended to be viewed from above , on the second floor . Looking down , visitors MD VB a symmetrical hollow brass bob weighing about 240 pounds and shaped IN an inverted teardrop . As it moved back and forth — facilitated by an electromagnetic push to keep it continuously swinging despite air resistance and vibrations in the cable — it MD knock down inch - or - so - high pins standing at fixed points along the circumference of a JJ circle . Over NN , viewers MD VB the direction of the pendulum ’s swing NN , implying that the NNP was rotating beneath them . The Smithsonian pendulum , IN all pendulums , moved in accordance with Foucault ’s sine law , which predicts how much a pendulum ’s path will distort each day VBN on its latitude . Absent any exterior forces , a pendulum MD swing back and forth in a single plane forever — there MD be no gradual angular shift . But the NNP is rotating , so the story is n’t that simple . Since all points on NNP ’s NN rotate as a unit , it follows that those located on the wider portions of the NN — nearer to the equator — must cover more meters each second ( i.e. , VB faster ) to “ keep up ” with the points tracing smaller circles each day at the extreme northern and southern latitudes . Though they do n’t feel it , a person standing in Quito , Ecuador , is moving with appreciably higher velocity than CD in Reykjavik , Iceland . Because each swing of a pendulum takes it from a point farther from the equator to a point nearer to the equator and vice versa , and the velocities at these points differ , the path of the pendulum is subtly distorted with every swing , gradually torqued away from its original orientation . The extent of this effect depends on where on NNP the pendulum is swinging . At the North Pole — where JJ NNS in latitude have JJ implications — the path traced by a pendulum MD shift through a full 360 degrees in a mere 24 hours , explains Thompson . At the equator , meanwhile , a pendulum ’s motion MD not be seen to distort at all . VBG his sine law , Foucault predicted that the path of his pendulum in Paris MD shift 11.25 degrees each hour , or 270 degrees in a day . And it did . His sine law allows anyone with a decent grounding in trigonometry to use a pendulum to determine their latitude . But mostly , at museums IN the NN , the pendulum has become an object that elicits wonder . As iconic as the elephant that greets visitors in the rotunda of the Smithsonian ’s National Museum of Natural History , the pendulum at the History and Technology museum was a meeting place , a striking backdrop for reflection and education . “ It was very much IN a fountain in a park , ” VBZ Peter Liebhold , a curator in the division of work and industry at the NNP History Museum . NNS and adults alike MD stare at the pendulum , meditating on its motion and meaning . CD morning in 1998 , before the museum had opened , the cable snapped , sending the massive bob hurtling towards the floor , narrowly missing a staffer . Rather than repair the cable , the museum elected to retire Foucault ’s pendulum . Its director at the NN decided the device did not have much to do with either NNP or history , VBZ Liebhold . The decision divided staffers . “ There were pendulum huggers and pendulum haters , ” Liebhold VBZ . Pro-pendulum employees VBD it was cool and fun to watch . The anti-pendulum group believed it did n’t add much to the museum ’s efforts to teach the NN about JJ history and culture . Though Liebhold VBZ he was in the haters ’ camp , he believes pendulums have their place , just elsewhere . A pendulum “ makes the masses more trusting of the NN of NN , ” he VBZ . Thompson agrees , and notes that while the pendulum is no longer needed to prove that the NNP rotates , “ it is useful if we can VB kids engaged in NN . ”

text: Last NN , retired Sacramento paramedic and firefighter Jesse Beltran VBZ he visited a dentist for what he thought was a standard procedure . Upon waking nearly four hours later , unbeknownst to Beltran , he believes a Radio - Frequency IDentification ( RFID ) chip had been implanted in the rear area of his mouth where the lower and upper jaws connect . During a November 29 interview , Beltran VBD this writer , “ A recent girlfriend of mine that was associated with law enforcement took me to a dentist that I ’d never before visited . Without my consent , the dentist VBD a very unusual looking syringe and knocked me out for between three and four hours . Since I ’d been in the JJ field for over 20 NNS , I ’m familiar with syringes , and this JJ - gauge needle looked IN the old - style equipment that JJ doctors VBD . ” The horrors got worse during this procedure . Beltran continued his account : “ When I regained consciousness three to four hours later , my entire chest was drenched in saliva . Supposedly , I had received CD root canals and had CD teeth capped . But after visiting a JJ dentist earlier this NN , his X - rays revealed that only CD root canal had been performed , and no crowns put in place . ” In an extensive portfolio presented to this newspaper , Beltran provided a series of X - rays and MRI scans that show what appear to be CD foreign bodies in the back portion of his mouth . Beltran claims CD JJ doctors have confirmed these results . When asked if he has experienced any physical afflictions as a result , Beltran replied , “ A JJ Marine VBD me that similar RFID chips are VBN by the U.S. NN on prisoners in Afghanistan to send and receive NN . The device in my mouth is approximately the size of a grain of rice , and depending on the frequencies being transmitted , I undergo nausea , vertigo , hearing loss and swollen glands . Plus , because [ I have a ] technical background , I can hear a ‘ 60 - cycle whine . ’ ” To clarify this phenomenon , Beltran explained , “ This 60 - cycle whine is an electrical sound emitted from the device , but with a higher pitch that I hear originating from IN my JJ ear , but not exactly . ” When Beltran visited a local district attorney with his X - rays , he was VBN , “ This was done because of something you VBP that somebody wants , or they do n’t VB you to VB something . ” The district attorney then VBD Beltran about S.B. 362 , introduced by NN senator Joe Simitian ( D - Palo Alto ) , which VBZ that “ subdermal implantation of RFID chips in the NN of California against a person ’s consent ” is illegal . Governor Arnold Schwarzenegger signed this legislation in 2007 . “ Why MD there VB to be such a law in the JJ place unless these procedures were already being performed ? ” asked Beltran . The obvious question at this point is : Why MD someone VB to implant an RFID device in Beltran ’s mouth ? This is where the story gets eerie . Beltran provided the answer . “ In 1991 I was the supervisor for a private ambulance NN in Sacramento when we were dispatched to the scene of a high - speed pursuit involving the potential kidnapping of a four - or five - NN - old girl , ” he VBD . “ The suspect was apprehended and dragged from his car by law enforcement officers and then beaten to death . However , it turned out that the suspect was actually the little girl ’s father , and it was n’t a kidnapping , but a custody issue . So , this NN ’s father was beaten to death with billy clubs before her very eyes . ” He added : “ After I tried to write a report about what I ’d witnessed , my supervisor VBD me to keep my mouth shut or I ’d be blacklisted . That ’s when the cover - up began . ” Still , why MD this incident affect Beltran nearly CD decades later to the extent that an invasive JJ procedure was perhaps conducted without his NN and against his will ? “ The motive leads back to me witnessing a murder that now affects the candidates ( in a local 2010 sheriff ’s NN ) who were in charge of the cover - up , ” he VBD . “ Last NN , I emailed CD of the candidates and asked : If a law enforcement officer is informed of a murder , are they required to report it ? Twenty minutes later I received a phone call from CD of the officers associated with the cover - up of this murder . If this NN is divulged , it will completely ruin the sheriff ’s NN [ in November 2010 ] . A colleague has RB VBN me that the sheriff ’s department and local FBI are behind what has happened to me . ” Although California politicians such as Senator Barbara Boxer ( D - Calif . ) and Representative Dan Lungren ( D - Calif . ) have offered no NN , nor has local NN , Beltran VBZ TruTV and Jesse Ventura have shown an interest in filming the surgery when the RFID device is removed from his mouth . Beltran has RB met with an area district attorney , who has yet to decide whether the crimes committed against him fall under local jurisdiction or that of the USA PATRIOT Act and domestic terrorism . text: It ’s that NN of NN when ambitious homeowners take to their lawns and roofs to outdo their neighbors in a game of who can overwhelm the local NN grid RB . Results MD vary from lonely candy canes to full - blown holiday light dragons . But whether you VBP full - throttle or prefer a low - key display of holiday cheer , CD thing is now JJ : NNP is watching . NNS at the Goddard NNP Flight Center in Maryland and Yale NNP in Connecticut VBD satellite imagery to track light patterns in 1,200 cities over CD and a half NNS . They VBD that increased light correlated perfectly with the holiday seasons for Ramadan in the Middle East , as well as Christmas and NNP NNP 's Eve worldwide . They RB saw variations in how cities and neighborhoods within those cities celebrate these holidays , the team announced this week at the NNP Geophysical Union 's annual meeting in San Francisco . " What ’s happening during the holidays is our patterns are changing , " VBZ Miguel Román , a physical scientist at NNP Goddard . In the West , we 're staying up late drinking eggnog and VBG home from work early . " Those NNS in behavior are NNS in the locations of demand for NN services . " Understanding such seasonal shifts might ultimately tell us what 's driving NN NNS at a local level . With hundreds of satellites circling NNP , it might seem easy to snap a picture of exactly what ’s down below . But getting RB high resolution images has been difficult , especially when homing in on urban environments . In 2011 , the Suomi-NPP satellite launched with a fancy schmancy camera aboard . This particular camera has low - light sensors that can pick up on wavelengths from green to infrared and create more intense images . The camera allows Suomi-NPP to take pictures of NNP at IN 1 am local NN every night at very high resolution . “ It ’s extremely sensitive . Allowing every single pixel to be overexposed , we can pick the faintest signal IN a fishing boat out of the coast of Somalia , as well as very bright signals IN volcanic magma on the NNP Island of Hawaii , ” explains Román . In 2012 , NOAA VBD the camera to make a composite image of a few months worth of lights at night . To make an image IN that , you have to run the raw NNS through special algorithms , to correct for white noise such as fires , reflective aerosols and moonlight . NNP wanted to be able to do this on a daily basis , so Román started exploring options . To VB a baseline , he looked at rural areas with little light pollution and at deserts . But when he took some initial NNS for Egypt and the Sahara , something looked weird , as if the lights were overly saturated . “ This was happening in urban areas , so we looked into that , and what we realized was that what we were seeing was that the increase in the signal was timing perfectly with the Ramadan calendar , ” recalls Román . He emailed urbanization specialists at Yale , and they were intrigued . Sure enough , they VBD the same spike the next NN . Over the next CD and half NNS , the team measured NNS for three holiday periods : three NNS of Ramadan in the summer ( in this NN ) and CD NNS of Christmas plus NNP NNPS from the week of Thanksgiving to the JJ week in January . Running the images through a specially designed algorithm , they compared the light signal during these periods to the rest of the NN in three geographic areas : the Middle East , North NNP and the Caribbean . Snow turned out to be a JJ problem . Looking at the JJ round of Christmas NNS from the central U.S. , Román saw a huge spike in Denver in 2012 . But it was n't just Christmas lights , it was lamp light reflecting off fresh snow , so they had to take out most cities north of St. Louis . Still , they were able to pick up on some general trends , and produced maps for the holiday periods . In 70 cities across the U.S. , lights twinkled brighter during Christmas and NNP NNP 's , regardless of JJ or other factors . " [ It 's ] tracking this national shared tradition , " VBZ Román . City suburbs in particular showed a 30 to 50 percent increase in lighting intensity , while most urban centers saw a 20 to 30 percent increase . That 's likely because a bigger yard means more NN for blow - up Santas and glow - in - the - dark reindeer . In Román 's native Puerto Rico , the Christmas pattern emerged as well . VBG their algorithm , the researchers were actually able to group together cultural centers of holiday festivals , industrial cities and more rural towns VBN on the citizens ' NN habits . " [ We ] are now able to classify cities as a function of the NN behaviors of its inhabitants . Behaviors that are VBN on the norms , on the identities of a culture , " explains Román . " This is RB cooler than seeing Christmas lights from NN . " In the Middle East , the lights of major cities burned brighter during the holy month of Ramadan , typically culminating with a peak associated with Eid festivities . Generally , lights increased in the city center with group prayer activities at night and NNS VBG to work earlier . Differences across NNS stood out . Saudi Arabia had the most intense Ramadan increase , while the lights of Istanbul were a little weaker . Saudi Arabia is more conservative , while Turkey is more secular . " Nighttime lights RB track the cultural differences between these cities and the NNS that host them , " VBZ Eleanor Stokes , a graduate student at Yale who collaborated on the NN . Tel Aviv , notably , had no increase in lighting during the Muslim holy month . And cities in Iraq and Lebanon saw dips in nightime lights , which the researchers link to unreliable electricity . In Syria , decreases in nighttime light in Aleppo and Damascus likely corresponded to JJ and JJ unrest . " These nighttime lights RB are in some ways IN the EKG of a city , " VBZ Stokes . In Egypt , the researchers took a closer look at 20 Cairo neighborhoods and VBD that poorer areas saw a smaller peak during Ramadan , choosing to leave the lights off for financial or maybe cultural reasons . " You can VB those JJ and cultural imprints in the NN signatures themselves , " VBZ Stokes . The NNS do n’t give them an exact measure of the total NN use on a city block , but the lights do provide a proxy for tracking NN use patterns . “ This is the factor that ’s most sensitive to JJ behavior . When NNS turn on the lights , the next thing they ’re VBG to turn on is the toaster and the heater , ” VBZ Román . “ It ’s those patterns of behavior that we ’re trying to VB . ” Urban areas account for a huge chunk of NN use and NNS , so the researchers hope to overlay the NNS with NN NNS and NN consumption NNS in the future . " NN dioxide NNS is giving you the when , where and the how much . But it ’s not telling you what is driving it , " VBZ Román . Looking at the lighting NNS against NNS MD VB build more localized NN mitigation strategies . Román points out : " What 's VBG to work in NNP NNP City is n't necessarily VBG to work for Amarillo , Texas . " In this NN , the images provide a lot more than pretty pictures of NNP from NN . text: Miley Cyrus is what I call a “ barometer artist ” . That ’s because her act invariably mirrors whatever agenda needs to be pushed by mass NN at that particular moment . Indeed , Miley never had her own sound , her own image or her own message . Her entire act was always dictated by her handlers ever since she was a NN playing the role of Hannah Montana . Appropriately enough , Miley recently appeared in an episode of Black Mirror where she played the role of a NN - controlled pop star who has absolutely no NN over her career and her message . While her character ( named Ashley O ) keeps talking about “ empowerment ” to her fans , she ’s actually a heavily medicated slave who does as she ’s VBN by her handlers . Only a few weeks after the release of that Black Mirror episode , Miley Cyrus unleashes upon the NN Mother ’s Daughter – an NSFW music NN loaded with a bunch of calculated messages aimed a young NNS . Indeed , the NN is essentially an infomercial sponsored by powerful groups , lobbies , and VB tanks to propagate specific JJ messages . According to NN sources , Mother ’s Daughter is “ a statement made in support of gender equality , freedom and the fight against discrimination and sexual harassment ” . Of course , the NN was immediately praised by everyone in show business because that ’s the agenda RB now and nobody can oppose it . Abortions good . Genders bad . However , there is more to this NN than meets the eye . Let ’s look at it . The concept of the NN is rather simple : Lots of guest appearances by activists and other NNS that support a specific agenda . At the center of it all : Miley Cyrus wearing a red latex suit which features a symbolic “ accessory ” . Beyond the folk tales , the dentata aptly represents an important aspect of today ’s mass NN agenda : The weaponization of feminity . It is about VBG “ feminism ” ( a distorted version of it ) for JJ engineering . It is about turning the female body ( with all of its warm , receptive and nurturing qualities ) against its own nature . It is about radicalizing sexes and breeding hatred between males and females . It is about turning the sad reality of abortion into some kind of feminist NN move . Throughout the NN , lots of messages are flashed on screen . They all have a strange , Orwellian quality to them . A riot is “ a form of civil disorder commonly characterized by a group lashing out in a violent JJ disturbance against authority , property or NNS . ” Is every woman truly a riot ? Of course not . Some women are warm , gentle and loving NNS who do not feel the NN to be angry at everything . By trying to be “ feminists ” , these NNS actually reduce and generalize women to fit their own contrived vision . This next message is worse . The message is followed by a shot of a young girl . So , let ’s unpack “ virginity is a JJ construct ” . What does that RB mean ? As seen in past articles such as A Teen Vogue NN VBZ : “ This Idea That the Body Is Either Male or Female is Totally Wrong ” , there is a worrying trend in mass NN that urges young NNS to deny verifiable facts to embrace a radical and extreme JJ agenda . Here ’s an excerpt from an article justifying this line of thinking : The fact that the NN follows “ virginity does n’t exist ” with a young girl is weird . Do they VB that NNS are not virgins ? The NN then continues with more strange imagery . The next message in the NN gets spiritual . The lyrics of the song kind VBP in the same pseudo - satanic direction as the message above . The JJ verse goes as follows : As you might VB , hallelujah means “ Praise the Lord ” and is theologically the highest form of praise PRP can give to NNP . Combining this word with “ I ’m a freak ” and “ I ’ma do ya ” is basically a form of disrespect and blasphemy . In the second verse , we start to understand what kind of psychopath MD dream up these kinds of debasing messages . As seen in my article The Sick , Twisted Messages in “ Chilling Adventures of Sabrina ” , there ’s a clear and evident mass NN push to associate witches with feminism . Throughout the NN , this chorus is repeated ad - nauseam : Miley VBZ that she ’s nasty and evil because there ’s “ something in the NN ” . That ’s an interesting NN NN . Her other NN is that she ’s nasty and evil because she ’s IN her mother . Now that ’s an uplifting message for the youth . Speaking of witch ( not a typo ) , Miley ’s mother Tish Cyrus makes an appearance in the NN . The NN RB features other “ guests ” . Is this NN celebrating “ diversity ” or exploiting it ? As stated countless times in previous articles , everyone has the absolute NN to live in whatever NN that makes them happy and comfortable . But there ’s a fine line between accepting NNS and hunting down the most “ diverse ” NNS and exploiting them in videos as if they were circus freaks for maximum virtue signaling points . Here ’s what probably happened behind the scenes : While clamoring “ inclusivity ” , videos IN this NN actually reduces NNS to attributes such as “ trans ” or “ disabled ” . This final image sums up the entire NN . Does this image convey NN ? Or the exact opposite ? Miley sits on a carousel horse that is meant to VB RB in circles . She wears JJ studio props as an armor . Miley is not leading anyone anywhere . She ’s a highly controlled pop star in a studio who is taking orders from a director ( who is a white male , by the NN ) . The chorus might VB “ Do n’t f*ck with my freedom ” . However , those who own her never gave her any of it . Mother ’s Daughter is not art . It is propaganda and indoctrination . In only a few short minutes , this NN manages to mix the occult elite ’s obsession with abortions , gender - blurring , and satanism . Let ’s not forget the fact that they VBP that virginity is a “ JJ construct ” . In the end , behind all of the virtue signaling and the buzzwords , this NN actually celebrates only CD thing : The corruption of everything that is pure and sacred . P.S. text: This chapter discusses how the simplest propagation scenario VBN in analytical modeling is the JJ NNP with PEC NN under line ‐source excitation . On the single knife edge problem , the ray summation approach is VBN on the construction of four JJ rays , related reflection , and diffraction coefficients VBG Fresnel integral . The parameters of the Fresnel integrals are derived by VBG the image source and receiver for the reflected waves . The 2D propagation scenario is completed by choosing the appropriate transverse and longitudinal BC . This problem has analytical exact solutions in terms of Airy functions for the range independent vertical refractive index . text: JJ Federal Reserve Chair Janet Yellen has waded into a thorny JJ dispute involving a NNP of Chicago professor who has been critical of the Black Lives Matter campaign to slash NN department funding . Harold Uhlig , an economist at the NN and editor of the prestigious Journal of NNP Economy , has equated BLM protesters to " JJ earthers " and VBD they should have coordinated their protests with NN departments , according to the NNP NNP Times . In subsequent tweets , he has walked back some of the comments and on Tuesday VBD he was " was trying to make fun of that radical and untenable view of massively cutting funding of NN departments . Wrong words , mea culpa . But we all share the same goal . " He RB VBD BLM is " a movement that is sorely needed now and applauded by so JJ . " Earlier , though , he chided the movement : Yellen has joined a choir of economists who have criticized Uhlig , with some calling for his removal as editor of the journal . The central bank leader from 2014 to 2018 VBD in email to the Times that " the tweets and blog posts by Harald Uhlig are extremely troubling . " She added that " it MD be appropriate for the NNP of Chicago , which is the publisher of the Journal of NNP Economy , to review Uhlig 's performance and suitability to continue as editor . " . Yellen declined further comment . Uhlig and the journal did not respond to emails . As is the NN with most Fed officials , she has avoided involving herself in JJ issues . She led the San Francisco Fed during the financial NN and helped guide the central bank off away from near zero interest rates and the extensive bond buying programs instituted during and after the Great Recession . NNP Donald NNP chose not to reappoint Yellen , who was replaced with Jerome Powell . She is now a distinguished fellow at the Brookings Institution . The move to defund the NN has come in the wake of the killing of George Floyd in Minneapolis at the hands of NNS .

text: Under the circumstances , it was the best possible gesture of JJ support that NNP MD offer its diminutive Baltic ally . Better still was the timing . Ilves ended up in the Oval Office on 25 June , exactly CD week before US NNP George W. Bush MD host Vladimir Putin in Kennebunkport , Maine . The symbolism – Estonia RB , NNP second – was not overlooked in the Baltic NN . As Ilves VBD to Estonians , the invitation proved that membership of NATO and the EU was not just a series of empty obligations and formalities . “ If we VBP others , then they will VB us , ” Ilves VBD . Ilves and Bush RB met in November 2006 , just a month - and - a - half after Ilves ( the name means ‘ lynx ’ in Estonian ) was inaugurated , during the US NN ’s stopover in Tallinn en route to the NATO summit in Riga , Latvia . Judging by all accounts , the NN from Texas took an instant liking to the NN who was a teenage immigrant to NNP Jersey . So come April , when Estonia erupted in CD nights of rioting that left CD dead and more than a hundred wounded and caused extensive property damage , Bush remembered his JJ friend in the Baltics . He wields a wonderful mix of intellectual insights and down - to - NN wisdom seldom VBN in JJ officials . Speaking on Ukraine ’s incessant woes , for instance , he is quick to point out that the crucial mistake was made in the early 1990s by the then NN Leonid Kravchuk when the latter refused to co-operate with a diaspora of three CD Ukrainians living in North NNP . By shutting the door on such potential expertise and investment , Kravchuk all but slammed the door to possible Western integration in his own face . Ilves MD VB . A son of Estonian refugees , he was born in Stockholm in 1953 . When he was thirteen his family moved to the US , where Toomas Hendrik ( he always uses both JJ and middle names ) later graduated from Columbia NNP ( BA ) and the NNP of Pennsylvania ( MA ) with degrees in psychology . Of his own background , Ilves has VBN : “ I speak English IN an NNP , I VBP IN a European . ” Remarkably , as a member of the European Parliament from April 2004 to September 2006 he was tireless in VBG these CD sides of his persona to bridge the transatlantic rift after the invasion of Iraq . Recalling that heady NN of 2003 , he VBD , “ There was too much hysteria on both sides of the Atlantic . ” Ilves eventually gave up his US citizenship to become Estonia ’s foreign minister in 1996 . In more than a decade of domestic Estonian politics , he has stood steadfastly in the centre of the JJ spectrum as a member of the Moderates , a party that he helped create . Thanks to Ilves ’s friendship with Mart Laar , a JJ prime minister , Estonia was the JJ European nation to introduce the JJ tax . He loves the rustic NN and enjoys sporting a pair of overalls and tilling the soil at his farmstead in Arma , just a short walk from the Latvian - Estonian border . Film is another favorite pastime . Recently he RB tried his talents at acting , taking a cameo role in ‘ 186 Kilometers ’ an Estonian picture about an out - of - luck actor who runs into sundry difficulties trying to make what should be a simple journey from Tallinn to Tartu , a NN town southeast of the capital . In CD of Ilves ’s charity drives , a few NNS ago he was asked to VB raise NN for disabled NNS by participating in a benefit concert . During the European Parliament ballot in 2004 , however , his JJ opponents from Res Publica , a JJ - wing startup , VBD this image of Ilves on its posters to scare the Estonian electorate into believing that the Chicago mob was threatening to overrun the Baltic NN . The NN campaign , which Ilves slammed as “ vicious ” and “ slimy , ” backfired , and the NNP Democrats won the most votes , walking away with three of Estonia ’s six seats in the EU legislature . The ‘ mobster ’ himself was appointed deputy chairman of the foreign affairs committee . CD - and - a- half NNS later , Ilves , who actually prefers bow - ties , was further vindicated when Res Publica , which bitterly opposed a second presidential term for Rüütel , threw its support behind his candidacy . For now , Ilves , who will celebrate his JJ NN in office on 9 October , faces tremendous domestic challenges . After the Soviet memorial debacle in April , Estonian society is deeply split – CD - quarter of the country ’s 1.3 CD are ethnic Russians . Given the current labour deficit , keeping the Russians – JJ of whom are non-citizens without the NN to vote in national elections – is a matter of JJ urgency . Tellingly , Ilves ’s JJ domestic trip after becoming NN was to Narva and Ida - Virumaa , towns in northeastern Estonia that are more than 90 % ethnic Russian . The appeal is RB directed at Estonians . Demographics , after all , will be the country ’s single greatest challenge in the 21st century . text: What is NN ? It ticks by , moment by moment , day after day . But it ’s so baked into our lives that we do n’t VB much about it , unless we ’re late for an appointment or suddenly notice those gray hairs in the mirror . Then the physicists weigh in , and NN suddenly seems more complicated . Einstein tells us that it can expand and shrink , while the second law of thermodynamics , which VBZ that the universe is growing more disordered , seems somehow to be tied to NN ’s “ flow . ” Carlo Rovelli has devoted most of his career to pondering the enigma of NN . An Italian physicist working at Aix - Marseille NNP in France , Rovelli is VBN among NNS for his pioneering work on loop quantum gravity — a NN that attempts to unite quantum mechanics with Einstein ’s NN of general relativity . The wider NN , meanwhile , has come to VB him as an eloquent , RB poetic writer on scientific topics . Rovelli ’s 2014 book , " Seven Brief Lessons on Physics , " sold more than a CD copies IN the NN . Now he ’s out with a JJ book , " The Order of NNP , " which zeroes in on that most peculiar dimension : NN . Recently , MACH spoke with Rovelli about the nature of NN , whether it has a beginning and if NNS might CD day master NN travel . The interview has been edited for length and clarity . MACH : What exactly is NN ? Rovelli : It is something very complex . We mistakenly VBP that NN is something basic , something very elementary . We imagine it ticking away the NN of the cosmos , in a succession of instants . This understanding of NN is wrong . Or at least , it ’s an approximation of a far more complex reality . This does n’t mean that the layperson ’s understanding of NN is an illusion . It only means that it holds up in a limited NN . It ’s IN thinking that the NNP is JJ . As RB as we move in a JJ region [ on the NNP ’s NN ] , we can very well consider it to be JJ . When we build a NN , for example , we do n’t VB to bother with the curvature of the NN of the NNP . But if we look at a larger scale , then definitely the NNP is not JJ . It ’s the same with NN . Our everyday intuition of it works very well , but only as RB as we do n’t look too far out into NN or too deeply into JJ distances , and only if we do n’t consider things moving at high speeds . What does physics have to VB about the “ flow ” of NN that NNS seem to feel ? It MD not be a physics problem . I VBP it depends on our brains and the complicated NN in which we form memories . It has to do with how we remember the past and anticipate the future . So to explain this passage of NN , this flowing of NN , I VBP PRP should look at neuroscience , not physics . What do physicists VB as the biggest unanswered question about NN ? The biggest of the open questions is : Why is the future so JJ from the past ? This is something that is not written into the laws of physics — the fundamental laws of physics do n’t distinguish the past from the future . This is still something mysterious , I VBP . Where does the second law of thermodynamics fit in ? VB of a film of CD billiard ball hitting another . The film looks the same forward as backward . It ’s the same with the NN orbiting the NNP , or the NNP VBG IN the NN . But this NN - symmetry breaks down with complex systems , where you can VB the amount of disorder increasing . IN a teacup breaking , or an egg getting scrambled ? UH . This increase in disorder is the second law of thermodynamics . The mysterious part is not so much that things VBP disordered ; of course , things VBP disordered . The mysterious part is , why were they ordered in the past ? Who ordered them in the past ? How far into the past should we look for an answer ? We ’re pretty confident that the universe started off with the NNP Bang . We do n’t VB what happened just before ; that ’s still very much debated . We VBP that things have been getting more and more disordered since the NNP Bang . The whole 14 - CD - NN history of the universe has been IN a deck of cards that ’s been shuffled over and over again , always becoming more disordered . But it ’s a puzzle , because the NNP Bang — this initial , compressed , hot phase of the universe — does n’t seem to have been very ordered . Yet somehow it must have been . So what was the source of this initial order ? That is still an open question . We do n’t VB . For a while , it seemed reasonable to VB that NN “ began ” 13.8 CD NNS ago , with the NNP Bang . But today JJ NNS are doubting this idea and considering the possibility that the universe existed before the NNP Bang . All options are open . MD NN travel ever be possible ? Well , “ NN traveling ” is what we do all our lives , is n’t it ? But you mean , can we jump quickly to the past or to the future . Jumping to the far future is certainly possible . It ’s only a technological problem , not a scientific NN . CD NN is to move very fast . When you move fast , NN passes very slowly for you — so if you MD run fast enough IN your NN JJ times , you MD do that in a NN span which for you is a couple of minutes , but in the meanwhile centuries pass for everyone else . The only difficulty is that the speed needed for this has to be very high , comparable to the speed of light . Another NN to jump to the future is to travel near a black hole . Near a black hole , NN slows down . So a starship MD wait there for half an hour and then move away from the black hole , and find itself millennia in the future . What about traveling back in NN ? That ’s much more complicated . It is not logically impossible , but it requires beating the second law of thermodynamics , which MD be IN beating the laws of probability . I VBP that if we ever achieve this , it MD be RB after we ’ve mastered forward NN travel . Has working as a physicist affected the NN you VBP about NN in your own NN ? I ’ve certainly changed a lot , in my NN of thinking , over the NNS . But I ’m not sure if it ’s because of my research or because I ’m getting older . I ’m much more relaxed . I ’m much more serene , less rushed . I VBP of NN more as a gift . But possibly it ’s just because I was 20 before , and I ’m 60 now . text: • Sometimes CEOs and managers in a NN deny or ignore negative facts about the organization 's performance . • Our intuition is to confront NNS suffering from this " ostrich effect " with facts — but this MD actually backfire . • Rather than dispute , you should show emotional leadership : Use curiosity and questioning to figure out their values and goals . • Once you understand , try to show them you share those values and explain how their current stance undermines the goals in the JJ term . ' Tis the season for holiday parties at the office . While they 're great for building workplace camaraderie and team spirit , when was the last NN a colleague — perhaps fueled by too much alcohol — VBD something so ridiculous that it made your jaw drop ? Perhaps a desk mate went into something JJ , claiming that George Bush is behind 9/11 or that Barack Obama is a Muslim from Kenya ? Or maybe your boss voiced NN denialism , arguing that the NNP is JJ or the Apollo NN landing was faked ? Just as disconcerting as the NN theorist in your midst is hearing a boss or colleague blatantly deny a business reality , such as NN that a favored product flopped or a decision was absolutely the wrong NN . So what do you do when someone you work with — RB the CEO of the NN — tells you something that 's demonstrably JJ ? Dealing with truth denialism — in business , politics and other NN areas — is CD of my areas of research , and I recently published a book on the topic . Here are some tips to navigate that Christmas office party or CD - on - CD with a boss in denial . It begins at the top The worst - NN scenario is when your chief executive is the NN in denial . A four - NN NN by LeadershipIQ.com , which provides JJ leadership seminars , interviewed 1,087 board members from 286 organizations of all sorts that forced out their chief executive officers . It VBD that almost CD quarter of CEOs — 23 percent — got fired for denying reality , meaning refusing to recognize negative facts about the organization 's performance . Other research strongly suggests that the behaviors expressed by CEOs " are felt throughout the organization by impacting the norms that sanction or discourage member behavior and decision making , and the patterns of behavior and interaction among members . " Together , these findings suggest that organizations where CEOs deny negative facts will have a culture of denying reality throughout the hierarchy . Of course , RB when the boss lives in the real NN , others in the organization MD hold JJ beliefs . Professionals at all levels can suffer from the tendency to deny uncomfortable facts in business settings . Scholars term this thinking error the ostrich effect , named after the ( mythical ) notion that ostriches stick their heads into the sand when they VBP threats . Our intuition is to confront colleagues suffering from the ostrich effect with the facts . But research — and common sense , if the colleague is your supervisor — suggests that 's usually the wrong thing to do . That 's because when someone believes something we VBP to be JJ , some kind of emotional block is probably at play . A number of factors explain why this happens . For example , research on confirmation bias shows that we tend to look for and interpret NN in ways that conforms to our beliefs . So RB if NNS are far below expectations , a CEO might reject that NN in projecting good financial forecasts on the belief that his actions should lead the NN to do well . In another example at a NN where I consulted , a manager refused to acknowledge that a person hired directly by her was a bad fit , despite everyone else in the department telling me that the employee was holding back the team . The manager 's behavior likely resulted from what scholars term the sunk cost fallacy , a tendency to double down on past decisions RB when an objective assessment shows the decision to be problematic . In both NNS , facing facts MD VB the CEO or the manager to feel bad . We often prefer to stick our heads into the sand rather than acknowledge our fault because of our reluctance to experience negative emotions . Research on a phenomenon called the backfire effect shows we tend to dig in our heels when we are presented with facts that VBP us to feel bad about our identity , self - worth , worldview or group belonging . In some NNS , presenting the facts actually backfires , causing NNS to develop a stronger attachment to incorrect beliefs . Moreover , we express anger at the person bringing us the message , a phenomenon researchers term " shoot the messenger . " There are JJ other mental errors that inhibit business professionals from seeing reality clearly and making good decisions . This is n't to VB that emotions are the problem . They are not . Emotions are fundamentally important to the JJ experience , and we VBP both reason and emotion to make good decisions . So rather than offering facts , your goal should be to show emotional leadership and try to figure out what are the emotional blocks inhibiting your colleague from seeing reality clearly . To do so , use curiosity and subtle questioning to figure out their values and goals and how they shape their perception of self - identity . And focus on deploying the emotional intelligence skill of empathy . Unfortunately , despite extensive research about the importance of emotional intelligence in professional settings , too JJ organizations still fail to provide such training . Once you understand your colleague 's goals and values , try to show you share them . Research shows doing so is crucial to conveying NN effectively in professional environments . Practice mirroring , or rephrasing in your own words the points made by the other person , which demonstrates you understand how they feel and helps build trust . With a CEO , you might talk about how both of you share a desire for the executive to be a truly strong leader . Try to connect the traits and emotions identified by the CEO to specific examples of his behavior . And regarding the manager with the problematic employee , I had a conversation about how she saw her current and potential future employees playing a role in the JJ - term future of the department she ran . I echoed her anxiety about the NN 's financial performance and concerns about getting funding for future hires , which gave me an additional clue into why she might be protecting the incompetent employee . After placing yourself on the same side , building up trust and establishing an emotional connection , move on to the problem at hand : their emotional block . The key here is to show them , without arousing a defensive or aggressive response , how their current truth denialism undermines their own goals in the JJ term . It can VB to cite a prominent example of a business leader accepting difficult facts to move forward , such as how JJ Ford CEO Alan Mulally helped save the NN through repeated course corrections . Research shows that offering positive reinforcement , without condescension , can be effective with colleagues and bosses alike . So when you 're at your next office party and encounter a truth - denying colleague , remember these tips and perhaps you wo n't have to spend the evening with your face buried in your hands .

text: The NN model Fast Ocean Atmosphere Model ( FOAM ) comprises an atmosphere and ocean component that are coupled to each other31 . Although simplified to run a JJ number of simulated NNS per day , it is a complex NN model that solves NN - dependent equations describing the fluid and thermodynamics of the NN . FOAM is a coupled general circulation model , meaning that it uses JJ circulation models for various aspects of the simulation . The Community NNP Model CCM3 is VBN to simulate the atmospheric components of the NN , whereas the Modular Ocean Model OM3 is VBN to simulate the dynamics of the ocean . The CD components are coupled , meaning that the transfer of heat and moisture at the boundary is calculated , as well as the distribution of any NN NN . Although the dynamics of the NN NN is not included in FOAM , other studies have examined how the inclusion of sea-ice dynamics VBZ the ability of a model to initiate Snowball Earth33,34,35 . In particular , when polar NN caps become JJ , they flow under the influence of gravity , facilitating the advance of the NN front equatorward . This result means that Snowball - NNP conditions MD onset at a lower value of methane concentration for models with sea-ice dynamics than for those without . In our simulations , which are heavily abstracted , this effect does not VB the qualitative conclusion that the topography of the NNP ( or more specifically , the albedo ) affects the onset of Snowball NNP . FOAM splits the atmosphere into 18 vertical levels , each with a depth in units of pressure of 55 hPa . The atmosphere has 40 latitudinal and 48 longitudinal grid points . The ocean model has a higher resolution , with 128 latitudinal and longitudinal grid points with a maximum of 20 vertical levels depending on the chosen ocean depth . These levels are not equally spaced , with the JJ 14 levels making up the top 1500 m of the ocean . For simplicity , the ocean depth is set to a constant value of 3100 m , CD of the fixed depths available in the ocean model . This depth is similar to the average ocean depth on present - day NNP . The JJ continent had a constant elevation of 20 m above NN level . The area of the oceans and continents does not VB when NN from the oceans is removed to form NN sheets on land . The depth of the continental NN sheets does not affect the continental topography . For simplicity , our simulations share the same orbital characteristics ( i.e. , orbital rotation rate , eccentricity , obliquity , date of perihelion ) as the present day , with the exception of a 360 - day NN . The solar constant is set to the predicted solar luminosity 2.4 CD NNS ago of 1100 W m−2 , CD % lower than the present - day value8 . To compensate for this lower solar constant , the concentration of NN gases in the atmosphere was higher than the present - day values10 . NN gases including NN dioxide and methane have been hypothesised to have created a strong NN effect on early NNP . This experiment assumes that NN dioxide is the largest contributor to this NN . CD possible range of NN dioxide concentrations during the Proterozoic is 4000 to 80,000 ppmv38 . A value of 10,000 ppmv is chosen , a number within this range and RB VBN in another NN 17 . The range of atmospheric methane concentration to test over was decided VBN on estimates10 and the results of modelling17 . This range is 1 –100 ppmv . The size and location of the continents 2.4 CD NNS ago is uncertain . CD plausible reconstruction places a supercontinent close to the equator , with a larger meridional dimension than zonal one25 . Another constructed simulation from the PaleoProterozoic glaciation VBD a similar series of continents 17 . A box containing the entire supercontinent occupies about 15 % of NNP ’s total NN area . To replicate this , a rectangular continent ( on a latitude– longitude map projection ) centred on the equator that is 15.6 % of the total NN area is VBN in this experiment . This continent extends from 56 °N to 56°S , and has a west–east width of 68° longitude . The continent NN type is set to desert rock , which has an albedo of 24%39 , replicating the plant - less continent NN of 2.4 CD NNS ago . The elevation of the continent is 20 m above NN level . Little NN is available about the topography of this supercontinent , and so we experiment with a number of hypothetical sets of mountain ranges at various latitudes ( Fig. 1 ) . They are all placed parallel to latitude lines , and the pairs are placed the same distance from the equator in each hemisphere . The mountains are approximately Gaussian in profile , have a latitudinal width of CD grid points , which is equivalent to about 1550 m ( 14° latitude ) at the equator , and each mountain spans the entire longitudinal dimension of the continent . The mountain dimensions are restricted by the 128 × 128 grid boxes , which limits how gradual the slope of the mountains can be , but they have a maximum height of 3000 m . A suite of model simulations varying the maximum height of the mountains VBG the M40 and M50 configurations showed no sensitivity to the onset of the Snowball NNP for mountain heights between 0.5 and 3.0 km . Such results are consistent with those where we vary the albedo of JJ terrain at low latitudes and show that the effect of the albedo on NN is greater than the effect of the terrain on NN . The simulations are performed in a NN - slice experiment where the model is initialised and then run until it reaches equilibrium . Each simulation is initialised with the conditions of the present NN . The polar NN NN is set to CD °C and the equatorial NN to 28 °C . The conditions being tested cannot maintain such a high NN NN , and so the NN evolves to a JJ , colder NN . The NN that the NN ends up in primarily depends on the tested value of methane . Simulations are run for a total of 400 NNS to give the NN enough NN to evolve to its JJ NN . But , this NN is not sufficient to produce NN sheets of substantial depth to rival the height of the mountain range or reach the stage where the NN MD flow a substantial distance due to gravity ( which MD not be modeled in FOAM anyway ) . Thirty - day mean values are output from the model 12 times each model NN . These NNS describe the monthly - mean NN of the atmosphere , ocean , and cryosphere ( NN and snow ) for that NN . In addition to the 49 simulations performed in the NN , 40 other simulations were performed with a continent comprising 27 % of the area of the NNP ( comparable to modern values ) , solar constant of 1142 W m−2 and a NN dioxide concentration of 2000 ppm . Methane was varied from 100 , 200 , 400 , 600 , 800 , 1000 , 2400 , and 2600 ppm . These simulations show a similar sensitivity to that presented in the present article .

text: Editor 's Note : An original version of this article , written by Natalie Wolchover , appeared on Live NNP Oct. 26 , 2012 . An updated version by Live NNP staff was republished on NNP 30 , 2017 . Members of the NNP NNP Society claim to VB the NNP is JJ . Walking RB on the NN 's NN , it looks and feels JJ , so they deem all NN to the contrary , such as satellite photos of NNP as a sphere , to be fabrications of a " round NNP NN " orchestrated by NNP and other NN agencies . The belief that the NNP is JJ has been described as the ultimate NN NN . According to the NNP NNP Society 's leadership , its ranks have grown by 200 NNS ( mostly Americans and Britons ) per NN since 2009 . Judging by the exhaustive effort JJ - earthers have invested in fleshing out the NN on their website , as well as the staunch defenses of their views they offer in NN interviews and on NNP , it MD seem that these NNS genuinely VBP the NNP is JJ . But in the 21st century , can they be serious ? And if so , how is this psychologically possible ? RB , a brief tour of the worldview of a JJ - earther : While writing off buckets of concrete NN that NNP is spherical , they readily accept a laundry list of propositions that some MD call ludicrous . The leading JJ - earther NN holds that NNP is a disc with the Arctic Circle in the center and Antarctica , a 150 - NN - tall wall of NN , IN the rim . NNP employees , they VBP , guard this NN wall to prevent NNS from climbing over and falling off the disc . ( In keeping with their skepticism of NNP , VBN JJ - earther NN theorist Nathan Thompson recently approached a NN he VBD was a NNP employee in a Starbucks in mid-May 2017 . In a NNP NN of the exchange , Thompson , founder of the Official NNP NNP and Globe Discussion page , shouted that he had proof the NNP is JJ — apparently saying an astronaut drowning was that proof — and that NNP is " lying . " ) NNP 's day and night cycle is explained by positing that the NN and NN are spheres measuring 32 NNS ( 51 kilometers ) that move in circles 3,000 NNS ( 4,828 km ) above the plane of the NNP . ( Stars , they VBP , move in a plane 3,100 NNS up . ) IN spotlights , these celestial spheres illuminate JJ portions of the NN in a 24 - hour cycle . JJ - earthers VBP there must RB be an invisible " antimoon " that obscures the NN during lunar eclipses . Furthermore , NNP 's gravity is an illusion , they VBP . Objects do not accelerate downward ; instead , the disc of NNP accelerates upward at 32 NNS per second squared ( 9.8 meters per second squared ) , driven up by a mysterious force called dark NN . Currently , there is disagreement among JJ - earthers about whether or not Einstein 's NN of relativity permits NNP to accelerate upward indefinitely without the NN eventually surpassing the speed of light . ( Einstein 's laws apparently still hold in this alternate version of reality . ) As for what lies underneath the disc of NNP , this is unknown , but most JJ - earthers VBP it is composed of " rocks . " [ Religion and NN : 6 Visions of Earth's Core ] Then , there 's the NN NN : JJ - earthers VBP photos of the globe are photoshopped ; GPS devices are rigged to make airplane pilots VB they are flying in straight lines IN a sphere when they are actually flying in circles above a disc . The motive for NN governments ' concealment of the JJ shape of the NNP has not been ascertained , but JJ - earthers VBP it is probably financial . " In a nutshell , it MD logically cost much less to VB a NN program than to actually have CD , so those in on the NN profit from the funding NNP and other NN agencies receive from the NN , " the JJ - earther website 's FAQ page explains . Who believes the NNP is JJ ? JJ - NN believers are not relegated to the hidden corners of the universe : Plenty of celebs have been quite vocal with their beliefs . For instance , on Jan. 25 , CD , rapper - singer Bobby Ray Simmons Jr. ( VBN as B.o.B ) released a track called " Flatline " in which he disses astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson , after the CD had a NNP battle over the spherical - ness of the NN . B.o.B is convinced NNP is JJ . A day earlier , the rapper tweeted : " No matter how high in elevation you are ... the horizon is always eye level ... sorry cadets ... I did n't wanna VB it either . " And then there 's Shaq . In a podcast that aired on Feb. 27 , 2017 , JJ NBA player Shaquille O'Neal proclaimed our home NN is JJ , saying that when he drives from Florida to California " it 's JJ to me . " Shaq later VBD he was just kidding . [ 5 Scientific Rebuttals of Shaq's NNP - NNP Claims ] Some believers have gotten creative in their quest to prove a JJ NN : NN theorist D. Marble posted on NNP on NNP 1 , 2017 , that he brought a spirit level aboard a flight from Charlotte , North Carolina to Seattle , NNP , to VB whether the plane 's nose MD dip to " compensate for curvature " of the NNP , he VBD . On the NN , he VBD : " I recorded a 23 minute and 45 second NN - lapse , which by those measurements means the plane travelled a little over 203 NNS . According to Spherical Trigonometry given to explain the Heliocentric model , this should have resulted in the compensation of 5 NNS of curvature . As you 'll VB there was no measurable compensation for curvature . " ( The air bubble in his level remained centered , which he VBD proves the NNP is JJ . ) The NN follows from a mode of thought called the " Zetetic Method , " an alternative to the scientific method , developed by a 19th - century NN - earther , in which sensory observations reign supreme . " Broadly , the method places a lot of emphasis on reconciling empiricism and rationalism , and making logical deductions VBN on empirical NNS , " NNP NNP Society vice NN Michael Wilmore , an Irishman , VBD NNP 's Little Mysteries . In Zetetic astronomy , the perception that NNP is JJ leads to the deduction that it must actually be JJ ; the antimoon , NNP NN and all the rest of it are just rationalizations for how that might work in practice . Those details make the JJ - earthers ' NN so elaborately absurd it sounds IN a joke , but JJ of its supporters genuinely consider it a more plausible model of astronomy than the NN VBN in textbooks . In short , they are n't kidding . [ 50 Amazing Facts About NNP NNP ] " The question of belief and sincerity is CD that comes up a lot , " Wilmore VBD . " If I had to guess , I MD probably VB that at least some of our members VBP the NNP NNP Society and NNP NNP NNP as a kind of epistemological exercise , whether as a critique of the scientific method or as a kind of ' solipsism for beginners . ' There are RB probably some who thought the certificate MD be kind of funny to have on their wall . That being VBN , I VBP JJ members personally , and I am fully convinced of their belief . " Wilmore counts himself among the JJ believers . " My own convictions are a result of philosophical introspection and a considerable body of NNS that I have personally observed , and which I am still compiling , ” he VBD . Strangely , Wilmore and the society 's NN , a 35 - NN - old Virginia - born Londoner named Daniel Shenton , both VBP the NN for JJ NN is strong , despite much of this NN coming from satellite NNS gathered by NNP , the kingpin of the " round NNP NN . " They RB accept evolution and most other mainstream tenets of NN . As inconceivable as their belief NN seems , it does n't RB surprise experts . Karen Douglas , a psychologist at the NNP of Kent in the NNP Kingdom who studies the psychology of NN NNS , VBZ JJ - earthers ' beliefs cohere with those of other NN theorists she has studied . " It seems to me that these NNS do generally VB that the NNP is JJ . I 'm not seeing anything that sounds as if they 're just putting that idea out there for any other reason , " Douglas VBD Live NNP . She VBD all NN NNS share a basic thrust : They present an alternative NN about an important issue or event , and construct an ( often ) vague explanation for why someone is covering up that " JJ " version of events . " CD of the major points of appeal is that they explain a JJ event but often without VBG into details , " she VBD . " A lot of the NN lies in the fact that they are vague . " The self - assured NN in which NN theorists stick to their story imbues that story with special appeal . After all , JJ - earthers are more adamant that the NNP is JJ than most NNS are that the NNP is round ( probably because the rest of us feel we have nothing to prove ) . " If you 're faced with a minority viewpoint that is put forth in an intelligent , seemingly well - informed NN , and when the proponents do n't deviate from these strong opinions they have , they can be very influential . We call that minority influence , " Douglas VBD . In a NN published RB March 5 , 2014 , in the NNP Journal of NNP NNP , Eric Oliver and Tom Wood , JJ NNS at the NNP of Chicago , VBD that about half of Americans endorse at least CD NN NN , from the notion that 9/11 was an inside job to the JFK NN . " JJ NNS are willing to VB JJ ideas that are directly in contradiction to a dominant cultural narrative , " Oliver VBD Live NNP . He VBZ conspiratorial belief stems from a JJ tendency to perceive unseen forces at work , VBN as magical thinking . [ Top CD Unexplained Phenomena ] However , JJ - earthers do n't fit entirely snugly in this general picture . Most NN theorists adopt JJ fringe NNS , RB ones that contradict each other . Meanwhile , JJ - earthers ' only hang - up is the shape of the NNP . " If they were IN other NN theorists , they should be exhibiting a tendency toward a lot of magical thinking , such as believing in UFOs , ESP , ghosts , the Devil , or other unseen , intentional forces , " Oliver wrote in an email . " It does n't sound IN they do , which makes them very anomalous relative to most Americans who VBP in NN NNS . " Editor 's Note : This article was RB published on Oct. 26 , 2012 , and then updated on NNP 30 , 2017 .

text: Ever since the NN spread across the NN , suspicions have proliferated about what is RB VBG on . Questions arose about the origins of the NN , the NN it makes NNS sick , the mitigation measures taken , the suspended civil rights , the connection with 5G , possible cures and medications , and about the role of NNP NNP in it all . These ideas are commonly framed as NN NNS . Yes , they MD all distrust the mainstream narrative and share certain characteristics , but they are not CD of a kind . They take so JJ JJ forms and have such varying degrees of plausibility that I question how useful it is to bracket them all under the same banner . To understand and effectively respond to the various NN NN NNS , we VBP to dig deeper . Listen to our Expert guide to NN NNS , a series by The Conversation ’s The Anthill podcast . The dominant explanation for the popularity of NN NN NNS is remarkably similar : these dark and unsettling ideas VBP NNS make sense of a complex and uncertain NN . They provide sufficiently JJ explanations for tragic events , and give back feelings of agency and NN . Since these ideas sometimes have real - NN consequences , from 5G masts set on fire to ignoring NN mitigation measures , various commentators condemn these NN NNS . Officials now VBP not only fight a NN NN , so their story goes , but an infodemic too . The problem with the generalising approach is threefold . It does not account for the motivations of NN theorists themselves ; nor for the JJ forms and plausibility of the various NN NNS ; nor for their relations with various JJ and societal issues . Providing uniform explanations for NN NNS fails to seriously consider their contents or underlying concerns . Similarly , it leaves untouched how certain NN NNS are weaponised in various propaganda wars . A closer look at these NNS or – RB better – actual engagement with the NNS propagating them , shows NN NNS not so much as a uniform coping strategy in unsettling times , but rather as a wide array of cultural expressions . These include suspicions of planned efforts to impose mass vaccinations , doubts about the origins of the NN , expressions of disgust for the ruling elite , geopolitical insinuations , pointers to an inflated NN panic , the scapegoating of certain societal groups ( Chinese or Jews ) , critiques on the methods and measurements of NN - CD NNS and deaths , discontents with powerful philanthropists , worries about the expansion of authoritarian NN policies , or concerns about corporate intrusion in the search for effective medications . This means , as I argue in my recent book , that we VBP to focus on the meaning , diversity and context of JJ NN NNS , as well as the NNS who subscribe to them . During my ethnographic research projects on contemporary NN cultures , I encountered a wide variety of NNS , ideas , practices and communities . Because NN NN NNS have yet to settle down , let ’s turn to some markedly JJ NN NN subcultures that have been RB for longer . They illustrate how JJ NN NNS and the NNS who subscribe to them can be . Starting with the anti-vaccination movement – of great concern to JJ . Because JJ anti-vaxxers in the western NN are highly educated urban hipsters , it is difficult to reject them as ignorant deplorables . Read more : Throwing NN at anti-vaxxers just makes them more hardline Next to critiques of NNP Pharma , NN hesitancy is informed by holistic and naturalistic ideas about NN and the body ; ideas rooted in alternative medicine and NNP Age spiritualities . In these subcultural worlds , emotions , feelings , experiences , testimonies and JJ relations are often more important guides than scientific NN . Rather JJ are those active in the 9/11 Truth Movement . Broadly interested in geopolitics and NN cover ups , these NNS challenge the mainstream narrative of 9/11 with competing factual and scientific NN . They advance visual proofs and mathematical calculations of why the towers MD not have collapsed by the planes , but indicate controlled demolition instead . These activists profess NN of physics , construction and explosives , and ground their legitimacy in this expertise . They are focused on “ exposing the official lies ” . IN JJ activists , they wish revolutionary NN , “ to end the regime and illicit NN structures responsible for 9/11 ” . The list of markedly JJ NN subcultures MD VB on . VB of the NNP Earthers , who deploy various scientific methodologies and perform actual experiments in the outside NN to show that it is not a globe but a Truman Show - JJ dome . Read more : I watched an entire NNP NNP Convention for my research – here 's what I learnt Favouring rational thinking and scientific methods is , however , no guarantee for brotherhood . 9/11 Truthers generally stay away from them as that MD harm their credibility . QAnon followers , meanwhile , deploy various strategies to interpret secret messages from their anonymous leader Q . These are VBN as “ crumbs ” or “ drops ” and are all part of their search for truth and redemption . Sharing JJ characteristics of millenarian NNP Religious Movements , QAnon followers anticipate a violent apocalypse when the NN will be dismantled and followers will be vindicated . This brief overview already shows the wide variety of themes , ideologies , plausibilities , origins , NNS and potential dangers of JJ NN NN subcultures . Regarding NN NNS as CD uniform category obscures all these differences and the various societal dynamics in which NN NNS play a role . This inevitably leads to simplistic explanations . Further , it has the JJ effect of collectively stigmatising certain ideas and NNS – and prematurely excluding them from legitimate JJ debate . NN NNS are not uniform – nor should our engagements with them be .

text: 1 . He was named for a Shawnee chief . William Tecumseh Sherman ( VBN as “ Cump ” to his friends ) was born in Lancaster , Ohio , on February 8 , 1820 . His father gave him his unusual middle name as a nod to the Shawnee chief Tecumseh , a magnetic leader who built a confederacy of Ohio Indian tribes and fought with the British during the NNP of 1812 . A relative later wrote that Sherman ’s father always shook off concerns that he had given his son a “ savage Indian name ” by arguing , “ Tecumseh was a great warrior . ” After losing his father at the age of 9 , Sherman was sent to live with Thomas Ewing , a renowned Ohio attorney and family friend who later served as a senator and the U.S. Secretary of the Treasury . The young Sherman grew close with Ewing ’s eldest daughter , Ellen , and they regularly corresponded through letters during his tenure at West Point and his early JJ career . Following a JJ engagement , the CD were married in 1850 in a NNP , D.C. , ceremony attended by the likes of NNP Zachary Taylor , Henry Clay and Daniel Webster . The couple later had eight NNS , CD of whom died from sickness while Sherman was serving in the Civil NNP . 3 . He played a role in triggering the California Gold Rush . While stationed in San Francisco in 1848 , Sherman helped convince JJ governor Richard Mason to investigate CD of the JJ reported gold discoveries in California . He was on the scene during a mission that confirmed the existence of rich gold deposits along the Sacramento River , and later penned the letter Mason sent to NNP relaying their findings . Coupled with other early discoveries , Sherman and Mason ’s fact - finding mission inadvertently set off a wave of gold fever in the NNP NNPS . In less than a NN , California ’s population more than quadrupled after thousands of speculators journeyed west to make their fortune . 4 . He had a rocky career in business . After missing out on combat in the Mexican NNP NNP and enduring a series of lackluster assignments , Sherman left the NN in 1853 to run a San Francisco bank . While he proved a competent businessman , the move corresponded with the bursting of the Gold Rush bubble , and his branch collapsed in the ensuing financial hysteria . Sherman was left humiliated , in part because JJ JJ friends — including future Civil NNP generals Braxton Bragg and George Thomas — had entrusted NN to him . To VB cover their losses , he eventually liquidated some $ 20,000 worth of his own assets . A despondent Sherman left the banking NN for good in 1858 . He later signed on as the JJ superintendent of the Louisiana NNP Seminary of Learning and NNP Academy — the school that MD become Louisiana NNP NNP . 5 . He MD have suffered a nervous breakdown during the Civil NNP . Following a promising performance at July 1861 ’s NNP Battle of Bull Run , Sherman was promoted to brigadier general and eventually given command of Union troops in Kentucky and Tennessee . Sherman had n’t wanted the role , and in short order , the weight of its responsibilities took a toll on his mental NN . He vastly overestimated the size of Confederate forces in the region , griped in his dispatches to NNP Lincoln and appeared constantly on edge . Historians have since speculated that he was suffering from depression or nervous exhaustion , but whatever its NN , the general ’s bizarre behavior eventually VBD its NN into the papers , some of which labeled him insane . Sherman requested to be relieved from his position in early November 1861 , and remained sidelined until that December , when he was reassigned to the Western Theater . He was later placed under the command of General Ulysses S. Grant , and following a crucial victory at April 1862 ’s Battle of Shiloh , the pair forged a winning partnership that lasted for the remainder of the NN . 6 . He cut off all lines of communication during the march to the NN . Sherman ’s March to the NNP was CD of the most stunning operations of the Civil NNP , yet few NNS outside of Georgia knew anything about it while it was underway . Before leaving Atlanta , Sherman intentionally severed all telegraph links to the North to VB shroud his moves in secrecy . The plan meant the Confederates MD only speculate about where Sherman and his 60,000 - strong rampaging army were headed , but it RB left the Union high command in the dark about the mission ’s progress . When asked about Sherman ’s whereabouts , a worried NNP Lincoln is VBN to have responded , “ We VBP what hole he went in , but we do n’t VB what hole he will come out of . ” Sherman MD finally reappear on December 22 , having slashed and burned his NN through the heart of Georgia . Upon reaching the NN , he sent a famous message to Lincoln that read : “ I beg to present you as a Christmas gift the city of Savannah . ” 7 . He offered lenient terms of surrender to defeated Confederates . Despite his reputation for “ hard ” warfare , Sherman MD RB be surprisingly — perhaps RB naively — generous in victory . When he accepted Confederate General Joseph E. Johnston ’s surrender in Durham , North Carolina , in April 1865 , Sherman offered very forgiving terms that granted general amnesty to the rebels and RB allowed for the Southern NNS to immediately re-enter the Union upon swearing an oath of allegiance . The sweeping agreement enraged U.S. Secretary of NNP Edwin Stanton , who rejected it out of hand and criticized Sherman for giving up “ all the advantages we had gained from the NN . ” Joseph Johnston was forced to surrender under more conventional terms , but he went on to become a good friend to Sherman , and RB served as a pallbearer at his old adversary ’s funeral in 1891 . 8 . He RB VBD his “ scorched NN ” brand of warfare against Native Americans . After the Civil NNP , Sherman was given command of the NNP Division of the Mississippi and tasked with pacifying the Plains Indians during the building of the transcontinental railroad . Sherman took to the job with characteristic vigor , orchestrating the relocation of the tribes and warning their chiefs , “ you cannot stop the locomotive any more than you can stop the NN or the NN , and you must submit . ” To VB break the natives ’ spirit , Sherman took a page from his Civil NNP playbook and set his sights on destroying CD of their primary resources : the buffalo . Beginning in the late 1860s , he organized the killing of some 5 CD bison in an effort to drive the creatures to the brink of extinction . Sherman continued his harsh policies after becoming commanding general of the army in 1869 , and by the 1870s , he had helped force most of the Plains peoples onto reservations . 9 . He repeatedly declined to run for NN . Sherman made no secret of his disdain for politics , once quipping that he MD rather spend four NNS in jail than in the White NNP . Nevertheless , during the 1870s and 1880s , NNP D.C. , movers and shakers often tried — and failed — to convince him to make a run at the presidency . Sherman tried to stamp out the speculation once and for all in 1884 , when he turned down an invitation to become the Republican candidate by saying , “ I will not accept if nominated and will not serve if elected . ” His unequivocal response has since become famous in JJ circles , where similar JJ refusals are often dubbed “ Shermanesque statements . ”
