text: NN is not about " nation building " " bringing democracy to dictatorships " " stopping terror " or any other claptrap . NN is about killing JJ beings . You VBP , I am a killer . I have participated in killing other JJ beings . The Vietnamese soldiers were trying to kill us . We were all young and brainwashed , and were n't smart enough ( yet ) to VB what we were being asked to do . I was on a firebase next to Highway NNP , a main thoroughfare in south Vietnam that ran through a portion of the country VBN as the Elephant 's Ear . It was called the Elephant 's Ear because of the shape of the border 's protrusion into Cambodia . Ours was an artillery station that carried a battery ( 6 ) of 105 mm howitzers and a battery of 155 mm howitzers . These are very JJ guns . We were RB camp to others : mortar squads , infantry units and sundry support services . This was in 1968 , the NN of the " Tet Offensive " , the great push by the North Vietnamese Army and the Viet Cong ( civilian anti-American guerrilla forces ) to rid the country of the " foreign invaders " ( us ) . It was CD peaceful Sunday evening in March , a cooler day in the hottest part of the NN . Everyone was VBG on their usual routines of duty and maintenence when the shit hit the fan . Mortars began to whistle in . The cry , " Incoming , incoming " went over the landing zone 's p.a. NN . Everyone went to the trenches , or VBD whatever cover they MD . I was caught out in the open . My only alternative was lay JJ on the hard NN , not far from the trench dug for our unit . Shells rained down all RB . Explosions went off everywhere , and my unit remained in the trench . I screamed " We better VB up here and do something , " to the guys in the trench . I thought they were cowering . They were not cowering . They had not received orders yet , and PRP does nothing in the NN without orders . Nearby , CD or CD of the fire pits , where excess round charges were kept , went up in pillars of fire . Gaining some self NN , I went to the NN supply and poured NN on the fire pits that were close to my unit to prevent them from VBG up in flames . The other members of my unit were still in the foxhole awaiting orders . The orders came . " Battery , adjust . Shell H.E. , lot six , fuse NN , deflection 1540 , azimuth 320 . " This VBD the unit how to adjust the aim of the huge guns . We all went about our tasks of preparing the JJ guns efficiently , heedless in this hour of necessity of the death whistling nearby , blind to everything but our task . Our hope only was group survival . This violence and shelling and death went on all night . As various units ran out of ordinance , we went through open areas to deliver fifty pound rounds on our shoulders . We were aware of , but not reacting to , the threat of instant death or injury all IN us . After a number of hours ( who can VB how JJ or how few ) exhaustion set in , and me and a buddy crawled into a culvert to sleep , the battle still raging all RB , but we were too exhausted to care . When I awoke , all was quiet , but the aftermath of the battle was there . There was devastation all RB . I VBD that the perimeter had been broached a number of times but superior firepower had stopped the NNS trying to break in , leaving their bodies to pile up inbetween the outer ring of wire and the inner . There were bodies all RB , or parts of bodies , or bodies blown in half , or bodies with heads split open looking for all the NN IN some kind of watermelon , with their bright red insides . Hundreds of parts or half or whole bodies . Numbers impossible to estimate accurately , due to the dismembered NN of the dead . There were probably hundreds . I stopped and gazed down at the corpse of a young boy , a dead N.V.A. soldier , and I saw someone very much IN myself . Unlike others nearby , he was whole . No apparant NN of death visible . I stared into his face , wondering about him . What kind of person was he ? Who was the family he had left behind ? Now I VBP that his family MD be left wondering forever whatever happened to him , because they MD never have his remains . They , after NNS of hope and greif , MD have to either assume him dead , or maybe lost , him only a memory . I still VBP his face these JJ NNS later , a brother unto me , me alive , him dead . He was as if sleeping , still free from obvious corruption if not for the pallor of his NN or the flies moving in and out of his nose . Shortly after dawn , we were called to order . Some names did not answer to roll call . No explanations at that NN were forthcoming . Tasks were given out . " Who wants body detail ? " VBD the sargeant . Only CD or CD volunteered . " Ok , you , you , you , you and you , VB out there and clean up . " The men were divided into teams , given wheelbarrows , and were sent out to bring the bodies and parts to a specific place . That went on all morning . It took a few days for the bulldozer to be shipped in by flying crane , and when it arrived , a giant pit was dug and all the JJ remains that were collectable were buried there . Our dead , about seven , were shipped home to the NNS . JJ of the enemy dead were not able to be collected . They were in enemy territory , and were left to the enemy . JJ had been wounded and crawled to hidden areas in the surrounding jungle where they died later . Some were near unexploded ordinance and were extremely dangerous . The end result was the stench of death . NNP , what a stench . It was all - pervading . Another result was a plague of flies . You had to eat anyway , knowing that the flies that were living on the JJ carnage were the same ones that were landing on your sandwich . There were clouds of white termite - IN flies that presumably fed on the dead , and these were called " body bugs " and were avoided as much as possible . The white flies were probably taking the blame for the other , more ordinary flies , who were more easily tolerated but who were in actuality RB feeding off the same " table . " With NN and burial , the plague of flies and the stench lessened . As the weeks went by , the battle was just another psychological scar torn through the distance of self , to be buried in the press of duty , to emerge NNS later , leaving you weeping unexpectedly at jovial occasions , much to the puzzlement of your family or friends . Some of the enemy had gotten through the perimeter , and had in a suicidal paroxysm , tried to do as much damage as possible before being killed . CD private , recently promoted to " temporary corporal " in lieu of his later promised advancement , ( we called them " candy stripers " as they wore a black band with their future rank on it ) was able to put an end to CD of these invaders . He had shot him through the back , the automatic weapons fire ( m16 ) moving through his body in a pattern , making a series of holes through from the back to the front of the body IN buttons on a jacket . This individual took polaroid photos of his " trophy " and gave them to me for safe keeping . Why he had selected me for this task was n't clear , but I was the wrong person to give them to . I buried them , repelled by the concept of JJ dead as trophy material . I got into a JJ fight when he tried to VB his photos and I VBD that I had " lost " them . Lots of others were not so squeamish , however . Some kept photos , or articles of clothing , weapons , medals or body parts , mostly ears , dried in the NN to a leather IN texture , from the ones they killed . I remember Sgt. Hirshberg telling me that he had to boil a belt that he got from a N.V.A. soldier 's corpse for CD days to VB the stink of death out of it . Soon after , Sgt. Hirshberg himself was VBN dead . Perhaps an N.V.A. soldier boiled his belt . That kind of thing that was as common as bread , then . Death . JJ beings lowered to the basest impulses within themselves , killed other JJ beings for the thrill of it , easily and without thought as easily as you MD fish in your pocket for NN to take the bus . Killing is legal , there . You MD VB to prison here , or perhaps VB the death penalty for the killing and and the mutiliation . In Vietnam it was sport . No morality . No ethics about who shall die and live . Nope . Death was sport . Or revenge . Often , the enemy MD horribly mutilate our dead , to instill terror or just to VB " fuck you " in the worst NN possible . We MD retaliate in kind . I remember a group of infantry men telling how they cut off the penises of their enemy and shoved them in the mouths of the newly dead as a kind of " fuck you back " gesture . Death then becomes a kind of communication , a grisly " postcard " if you will . Forget about JJ and wrong . It does n't exist . Only survival , hatred , revenge and killing . In the crucible of NN , it all boils down to the lowest denominators . There is little mercy . When we JJ beings are placed in a kill or be killed situation , we can only become killers . We VBP our friends die and revenge is our only outlet . You make the most of the situation by becoming the most beautiful artistic killer possible . JJ and wrong ? A just NN ? The NN was engaged in a psychological NN as well , entreating by helicopter equipped with speakers for the enemy to " give up , give up . You will be treated fairly and those of you who are innocent will be sent back to your families " . They flew over the countryside calling out in the Vietnamese language , " Chiu hoi , chiu hoi ... " They RB dropped leaflets with the same message by the thousands over the land . I saw firsthand the benefits of this " mercy program . " I was watching as an N.V.A. soldier was cornered in the nearby countryside and had decided to give in to the cries of " chiu hoi " that our soldiers were making . He put his weapons on the ground . He stood up with his hands behind his head . A burst of gunfire and a " Take that , motherfucker " and it was over . It was n't a puzzle to me why the program met with little success . I have n't RB gotten to the non combatants yet . Men , women and NNS , innocents all , falling to the stray bullet , being blown apart by the hidden mine , town destroyed by the misplaced bomb , or worse . It seems that we have forgotten about Lt. William Calley and the village of Mi Lai . William Calley was NN martialed and VBN guilty of the massacre of a number of innocent men women and NNS . He rounded up the inhabitants of this JJ hamlet , collected them together as possible enemy collaborators and ordered them all to be killed , burning the village after . The men who refused to fire upon the NNS who played a major part in his conviction . William Calley was an offering to the millions who were protesting the NN here at home . JJ others followed his methods and were not punished for their crimes . They suffer only the nightmares that doubtless still haunt them . It is estimated by some that CD to three CD non-combatants , civilians , died as a direct or indirect result of the Viet Nam conflict . I must VB that there are other ways . I must VB that we can find other means . To VB otherwise MD be anathematic to my very NN , and I MD either retreat into irreversible insanity or suicide , as so JJ of my fellows have done . Is it any wonder that the NN veteran has the highest rate of " non-functionality " : drug addiction , alcholism and suicide , of any other group ? Do you VB that NN veterans comprise the largest part of the homeless ? I VBP why they " drop out " . For NNS , I was unemployed , NN , RB into drugs . I VBD it impossible to work a job that paid taxes to the Death Machine . By the grace of NNP I escaped the fate of so JJ , to be reduced to a voiceless suffering shell of what I MD be . I came back alive from this cauldron of death to tell you that there must be another NN . So JJ others did not come back , will not come back , and I speak for them . Let us pray for peace .

text: Asian stocks ended the week with a mixed session Friday , but off their earlier lows . Japan closed almost JJ despite making sharp losses in the morning . South Korea finished just slightly lower . Shares in exporters dropped , derailing a rally in Asian markets the previous day that saw Japanese stocks post their biggest daily gain in six NNS on optimism about the JJ economy . The financial sector RB slid after Moody 's Investors Service on Thursday cut its top " AAA " rating on a unit of FGIC Corp by six notches , raising fears about selloffs in the debt guaranteed by the U.S. bond insurer . text: JJ groups have blasted draft text of the Trans - Pacific Partnership ( TPP ) released yesterday by WikiLeaks as potentially devastating to the environment and wildlife . The massive 12 - nation free trade agreement has been negotiated in secret now for almost four NNS , and the NN release by WikiLeaks shows that key JJ safeguards in the agreement are being stripped away , including a ban on shark fining and illegal logging , as well as legally - enforced pollution regulations . “ If the environment chapter is finalized as written in this leaked document , NNP Obama ’s JJ trade record MD be worse than George W. Bush ’s , ” Michael Brune , executive director of the Sierra Club , VBD bluntly . “ This draft chapter falls JJ on every single CD of our issues — oceans , fish , wildlife , and forest protections — and in fact , rolls back on the progress made in past free trade pacts . ” The TPP has been CD of the Obama Administration ’s top priorities for the Pacific region , but green groups VBP that it looks IN the administration has given significant ground on crucial JJ issues in a desire to VB the deal signed , which has already run past its goal of finalization by 2013 . JJ past free trade agreements have wholly lacked any legally - binding JJ safeguards , but in 2007 then U.S. NNP George W. Bush struck an agreement with democrats to include JJ safeguards in all future free trade agreements . However , environmentalists are now concerned that this requirement will bring about little JJ gains in the TPP . For example , the draft text completely lacks any enforcement . An analysis by Jane Kelsey with the NNP of Aukland finds that the draft text “ falls far below the standards ” set by the U.S. Congress in 2007 . “ Negotiators are allowing a unique opportunity to protect wildlife and support legal sustainable trade of renewable resources to slip through their fingers . these nations account for more than a quarter of JJ trade in fish and wood NNS and they have a responsibility to address trade ’s impact on wildlife crime , illegal logging , and overfishing , ” VBD Carter Roberts , NNP of NNP Wildlife Fund ( WWF ) , who called the NN leak a “ peek behind the curtain . ” According to the release by WikiLeaks , the TPP as it stands does not RB require member nations to uphold commitments to JJ JJ agreements , such the Convention on International Trade in Endangered NNP ( CITES ) . Criticism of the TPP goes well - beyond JJ issues , however . JJ groups have complained of the investor - NN settlement agreement in the plan that allows corporations to sue NNS when contracts are breached . Critics of this model VBP it benefits foreign investors as they expense of JJ rights , working conditions , and the environment . Negotiations have RB been blasted for being held completely behind closed doors , with some U.S. Senators complaining that multinational corporations are privy to the negotiations while the U.S. Congress is left in the dark . In addition to the U.S. , TPP member NNS include Australia , NNP Zealand , Canada , Mexico , Chile , Japan , Singapore , Malaysia , Brunei , Vietnam and Peru .

text: Pluto 's NN hosts blades of NN that soar to the height of skyscrapers — and researchers have narrowed down exactly how the dramatic features form . According to JJ research , the blades are made mostly of methane NN , and form similarly to ( much shorter ) spikes of snow and NN on NNP . When the NNP Horizons spacecraft flew by Pluto in July 2015 , researchers observed an astonishing variety of terrains across the dwarf NN . JJ and cratered areas on the dwarf NN 's NN point to its varied geological activity , composition and evolution over NN . The jagged spikes targeted in this latest NN form at the highest altitudes on Pluto 's NN , near its atmosphere , where methane is able to freeze out of the atmosphere — skipping straight from solid to gas without ever becoming liquid . When the NN is a bit warmer , parts of the methane NN sublimate away , heading straight back to gas form , according to the JJ NN . " When we realized that bladed terrain consists of tall deposits of methane NN , we asked ourselves why it forms all of these ridges , as opposed to just being JJ blobs of NN on the ground , " Jeffrey Moore , a NNP Horizons team member and lead researcher on the JJ work , VBD in a statement . " It turns out that Pluto undergoes NN variation and sometimes , when Pluto is a little warmer , the methane NN begins to basically ' evaporate ' away . " On NNP , such structures are called penitentes , and stretch just a few meters in height in high - altitude regions along the NN 's equator . Slight irregularities can turn into dramatic spikes of snow as the structures ' surfaces concentrate sunlight toward certain regions , sublimating some parts faster than others and leading to longer and spikier forms . The presence of penitentes on Pluto tell researchers more about how its NN and air NN VBP over NN , according to the statement , and the link between methane 's presence and high elevations can VB researchers map the dwarf NN 's topography in places where they have lower - resolution views . The JJ work will appear in an upcoming issue of the journal Icarus . Email Sarah Lewin at slewin@space.com or follow her @SarahExplains . Follow us @ Spacedotcom , NNP and Google + . text: Israel 's Beresheet lunar lander captured this selfie , which was released March 5 , when the spacecraft was 23,363.5 NNS ( 37,600 kilometers ) from NNP . Australia is clearly visible . Israel 's JJ lunar lander has notched another important milestone — its JJ in - NN selfie . The newly released photo shows the robotic lander , VBN as Beresheet , looking back at NNP from a distance of 23,363.5 NNS ( 37,600 kilometers ) . " In the photo of NNP , taken during a slow spin of the spacecraft , Australia is clearly visible , " mission team members wrote in an image description today ( March 5 ) . " RB seen is the plaque installed on the spacecraft , with the Israeli flag and the inscriptions ' Am Yisrael Chai ' and ' JJ Country , JJ Dreams . ' " The Hebrew phrase " Am Yisrael chai " translates as , " The nation of Israel lives , " or , " The NNS of Israel live . " Several more such maneuvers are on the docket in the near future . If all goes according to plan , Beresheet — which means " in the beginning " in Hebrew — will be captured into lunar orbit on April 4 , then drop softly onto the NN 's NN on April 11 . That landing MD be a major achievement . To date , the only entities to pull off a soft lunar touchdown are three superpower nations : the Soviet Union , the NNP NNPS and NNP . SpaceIL began as a competitor in the Google Lunar X Prize , a $ 30 CD race that asked privately funded teams to land a robot on the NN and have it perform a few basic tasks . The contest ended last NN without a winner , but SpaceIL and several other JJ teams continued shooting for the NN . The entire Beresheet mission , including launch , costs about $ 100 CD , mission team members have VBN . Beresheet 's ride through NN has n't been entirely smooth . Shortly after liftoff , team members noticed that the craft 's star trackers , which are critical to navigation , are susceptible to blinding by solar radiation . And Beresheet 's computer performed a reset unexpectedly just before the craft 's second planned engine burn . Mission team members have overcome these issues . For example , they traced the computer reset to cosmic radiation and firmed up Beresheet 's defenses with a software update . The lander was then able to execute the engine burn , which put Beresheet back on track toward the NN . text: On March 11 , 2011 , an earthquake measuring 9.0 on the Richter scale struck Japan , bringing a destructive tsunami along with it . CD of the sites most affected by the devastation was the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear NN plant , which experienced a partial meltdown CD days after the quake . The incident is being called the worst nuclear accident since the 1986 disaster at Chernobyl , and it has shown few signs of slowing down . Click ahead to VB 11 other history - making nuclear disasters . By Daniel Bukszpan , Special To CNBC.com Posted 16 Mar 2011 On April 26 , 1986 , a reactor at the Chernobyl NN plant in Ukraine exploded , causing the worst nuclear accident the NN has seen . It sent a plume into the atmosphere with radioactive fallout that was 400 times greater than that released in the atomic bombing of Hiroshima . The plume drifted across much of the western Soviet Union . Parts of Eastern , Northern and Western Europe were RB affected . Fifty NNS were killed at the reactor site at the NN of the accident , but the number of NNS across Europe who VBD themselves in the path of the radioactive plume is anybody ’s guess . A report from the NNP Nuclear Association ( http://world-nuclear.org/info/chernobyl/inf07.html) claims that over CD CD NNS MD have been exposed to radiation . However , the full extent of the damage is unlikely to ever be VBN . Until March 2011 , the worst nuclear accident in the history of Japan took place at a uranium facility in Tokaimura on September 30 , 1999 . Three workers were attempting to mix nitric acid and uranium to form the fuel uranyl nitrate . However , the workers unknowingly VBD seven times the allowable limit of uranium , and the reactor MD n’t stop the solution from reaching critical mass . The three technicians were exposed to massive gamma and neutron radiation poisoning , which killed CD of them . More than 70 other workers received high doses of radiation as well . After an investigation , the International Atomic NNP Agency saidthat the accident had been caused by " JJ error and serious breaches of safety principles . " The worst nuclear accident in U.S. history took place on March 28 , 1979 at the Three Mile Island plant in Pennsylvania . A cooling NN failed , causing a partial meltdown , but a full meltdown was averted and there were no fatalities . However , despite the positive outcome and despite the passage of more than 30 NNS , the incident remains fresh in the minds of those who are old enough to remember it . The effect of the accident on the U.S. nuclear NN industry was major . The meltdown gave JJ Americans second thoughts about the risks of VBG nuclear NN , and the construction of JJ reactors , which had been steadily increasing since the 1960s , slowed substantially . Over 50 nuclear plant construction projects were cancelled in just four NNS , and the number of ongoing projects declined from 1980 until 1998 . CD of the worst nuclear contamination incidents in the NN took place in Goiania , Brazil . A radiotherapy institute in the city had relocated , leaving behind a teletherapy unit that still contained cesium chloride . On September 13 , 1987 , CD scavengers VBD the unit , carted it away in a wheelbarrow and sold it to a junkyard . The owner invited friends and family to VB the glowing blue material inside , inadvertently exposing them to radiation . All of them then went their separate ways and irradiated friends and family all over the city . In all , 245 NNS were exposed to radiation and four NNS died . According to Eliana Amaral of the International Atomic NNP Agency , CD good thing came out of the catastrophe . " Before the 1987 accident … there was no awareness that sources must be controlled from ‘ cradle to grave ’ and to prevent the NN accessing them . After the accident these concepts were fostered . " On July 4 , 1961 , the Soviet submarine K - CD was in the North Atlantic Ocean when it developed a radioactive leak . It had no coolant NN in place to stop the reactor from overheating and exploding , so with no other options , the crew entered the reactor compartment and fixed the leak , exposing themselves to levels of radiation in the process that were certain to kill them . All eight crew members who had fixed the leak died of radiation poisoning within three weeks of the incident . The rest of the crew , the submarine and the ballistic missiles that it carried RB became contaminated . When K - CD met up with the submarine that had intercepted its distress call , it was towed to base , which it contaminated . Then , as it was repaired over the course of CD NNS , the surrounding area and the repair workers RB became contaminated . Twenty of the submarine ’s original crew RB died of radiation sickness over the next few NNS . In the NNS following NNP NNP II , the NNP NNPS was the foremost nuclear NN in the NN . In an effort to catch up , the Soviet Union quickly built nuclear NN plants and cut corners in order to keep pace . The Mayak plant near the city of Kyshtym had a tank with a substandard cooling NN as a result , and when it failed , the increasing NN caused an explosion that contaminated almost 500 NNS of the surrounding area . Initially , the Soviet NN did n’t disclose what had happened , but CD week later they had little choice . 10,000 NNS were evacuated from the area when some began to show signs of radiation sickness . Although the Soviet NN refused to disclose any NN about the accident , a NN in Radiation and JJ Biophysicsestimates that at least 200 NNS died from exposure to radiation . The Soviet NN finally declassified NN about the disaster in 1990 . On October CD , 1957 , Windscale became the site of the worst nuclear accident in British history , and the worst in the NN until Three Mile Island 22 NNS later . A facility had been built there to produce plutonium , but when the US successfully designed a nuclear bomb that VBD tritium , the facility was VBN to produce it for the UK . However , this required running the reactor at a higher NN than its design MD sustain , and it eventually caught fire . Operators at RB worried that extinguishing the flames with NN MD VB a hydrogen explosion , but ultimately gave in and did so as the NN escalated . It worked , but not before a sizeable amount of radiation had been unleashed into the surrounding area . A 2007 studyestimated that the incident had led to over 200 NNS of cancer in the surrounding population . The Stationary Low - NN Reactor Number CD , or SL - 1 , was a nuclear reactor located in the desert forty NNS outside of Idaho Falls , Idaho . On January 3 , 1961 , the reactor exploded , killing three workers and causing a meltdown . The NN was a NN rod that had been withdrawn incorrectly , but RB after an investigation that took CD NNS to complete , the actions taken by the workers just prior to the accident were never discovered . Although the accident released radioactive material into the atmosphere , it was considered a JJ amount , and the reactor ’s remote location helped to minimize damage to the neighboring population . Still , the incident is notable for being the only fatal nuclear reactor accident in US history , and for inspiring a NN to the design of nuclear reactors , so that a mishap involving a single NN rod MD not do this kind of damage . On January 21 , 1968 , a US Air Force B - 52 bomber was running a “ Chrome Dome ” mission , a Cold War-era operation in which US bombers with nuclear payloads stayed in the air at all times , all with nearby targets in the Soviet Union that were to be attacked if commanded . The bomber , which was carrying four hydrogen bombs caught fire . The nearest emergency landing location was at Thule Air Base in Greenland , but there was not enough NN to reach it , so the crew abandoned the bomber . When it crashed , the nuclear payload ruptured and the area became contaminated with radiation . The March 2009 issue of NNP magazine classified the event as CD of the worst nuclear accidents of all NN . The 1968 incident caused the immediate discontinuation of “ Chrome Dome ” missions , and more stable explosives were eventually developed so that nuclear weapons MD be less likely to explode in an accident . The Bohunice nuclear NN plant was the JJ to be built in Czechoslovakia . The reactor was VBN on an experimental design that was meant to run on uranium mined in Czechoslovakia . However , the JJ - of - its - kind facility had multiple accidents , and it had to be shut down more than 30 times . CD workers had been killed in a 1976 incident , but the worst mishap occurred on February 22 , 1977 when a worker removed NN rods incorrectly during a routine fuel NN . This simple error caused a massive radioactive leak , and the ensuing accident earned a level 4 rating on the International Nuclear Event Scale of 1 to 7 . The Soviet NN covered up the accident , so no reliable estimates of casualties have been released to the NN . However , in 1979 , the NN decommissioned the plant , and it is expected to be fully dismantled in 2033 .

text: Yesterday , in the post “ Just How Profoundly Have We Been Lied To About WWII ? , ” FOTM ‘s TrailDust asks whether all we ’ve been VBN about WWII , specifically Hitler and the Nazis , is actually JJ . For that , I applaud TrailDust ’s courage , as I VBP NOTHING should a priori be ruled beyond the realm of questioning . This post is my nugget of contribution to TrailDust ’s query . A persistent popular misconception of Hitler and the Nazis is that they were Christians . Nothing can be further from the truth . Instead , Hitler and the Nazis were animated by Nordic paganism and the occult . The John Hay Library at Brown NNP contains a special collection — 81 of Hitler ’s vast 16,000 - volume library . The whereabouts of most of Hitler ’s books is a mystery , although most scholars VBP they ’re scattered IN NNP . We do VB that 1,200 of them are in the Library of Congress in NNP , 81 in the John Hay Library . ( Brown NNP ) Hitler marked the margins of his books with vertical lines beside paragraphs or sentences he thought important . According to Timothy Ryback , in his book , Hitler ’s Private Library : The Books That Shaped His NNP , CD notable subject represented in the John Hay Library ’s Hitler collection is the occult , including a book that Hitler had marked — Ernst Schertel ’s Magic : History , NNP and Practice ( 1923 ) . Ryback points to CD marked sentence in Magic as quite chilling , given Hitler ’s history : Some consider Hitler to be demonically possessed . As an example , Jean - Michel Angebert asks in The Occult and the Third Reich : The Mystical Origins of Nazism and the Search For the Holy Grail ( pp. 191 and 22 ) : Lewis A. Sumberg , in his “ Translator ’s Preface ” to Angebert ’s volume , pointedly asks ( pp. xii and xiii ) : Italian Foreign Minister Count Galeazzo Ciano wrote in his diary : “ I am certain that RB if the Germans were given more than they ask for , they MD attack just the same , because they are possessed by the demon of destruction . ” ( Galeazzo Ciano , The Ciano Diaries , p. 582 . ) More recently , in an interview with Vatican Radio , the late Father Gabriel Amorth , Vatican ’s chief exorcist , VBD : “ I am convinced that the Nazis were all possessed . All you have to do is VB about what Hitler . . . did . Almost certainly they were possessed by the Devil . You can tell by their behaviour and their actions , from the horrors they committed and the atrocities that were committed on their orders . ” In fact , Vatican documents revealed that wartime pontiff Pope Pius XII had attempted a JJ - distance exorcism of Hitler . But the effort failed because , as Fr. Amorth explained , the possessed person must be consenting and willing and in the presence of the exorcist for the demon - banishing to succeed . Those who had VBN Hitler thought he was demonically possessed . Nazi Minister of Propaganda Joseph Goebbels admitted he did not RB VB Hitler , although he worked with and saw the Führer almost every day . Goebbels VBD his aide - de-camp , Prince Schaumburg - Lippe , that there were times when Hitler gave him “ the chills . ” The most striking testimony is that by Hermann Rauschning , a Nazi leader who later fled to the U.S . In his 1939 book , Hitler VBD Me , Rauschning described Hitler as controlled by “ malefic influences of which he was no longer the master . ” A chronic insomniac , Hitler ’s sleeplessness became worse after 1934 , his minimal sleep frequently interrupted by crying spells and night terrors . As recounted by Rauschning , during CD of his night terrors : “ Hitler was standing there in his bedroom , stumbling about , looking IN him with a distraught look . He was muttering : ‘ It ’s him ! It ’s him ! He ’s here !’ His lips had turned blue . He was dripping with sweat . Suddenly , he uttered some numbers which made no sense , then some words , then bits of sentences . It was frightening . He VBD terms which were strung together in the strangest NN and which were absolutely weird . Then , he again became silent , although his lips continued to move . He was given a massage and something to drink . Then , all of a sudden , he screamed : ‘ There ! Over there ! In the corner ! Who is it ? ’ He was jumping up and down , and he was howling . They reassured him that everything was all JJ , and he gradually calmed down . ”

text: With the region ’s population booming because of the Pike ’s Peak gold rush , Congress creates the JJ Territory of Colorado . When the NNP NNPS acquired it after the Mexican NNP ended in 1848 , the land that MD CD day become Colorado was nearly unpopulated by Anglo settlers . Ute , Arapaho , Cheyenne , and other Native Americans had occupied the land for centuries , but the Europeans who had made sporadic appearances there since the 17th century never stayed for RB . It was not until 1851 that the JJ permanent non-Indian settlement was established , in the San Luis Valley . As with JJ other western regions , though , the lure of gold launched the JJ major Anglo invasion . In July 1858 , a band of prospectors working streambeds near modern - day Denver VBD tiny flecks of gold in their pans . Since the gold - bearing streams were located in the foothills not far from the massive mountain named for the explorer Zebulon Pike , the subsequent influx of hopeful miners was termed the Pike ’s Peak gold rush . By the spring of 1859 , an estimated 50,000 gold seekers had reached this latest of a JJ series of JJ El Dorados . As the JJ gold - bearing streams to be discovered played out , prospectors moved westward into the rugged slopes of the Rocky Mountains in search of JJ finds . Wherever sizeable deposits were discovered , ramshackle mining camps IN Central City , Nevadaville , and Black Hawk appeared , sometimes almost overnight . Meanwhile , out on the JJ plains at the edge of the mountains , Denver became the central supply town for the miners . Although few miners came to Colorado planning to stay RB , they were eager to establish some semblance of “ law and order ” in the region in order to protect their property rights and gold dust . Far from the seats of eastern NN , the miners and townspeople cobbled together their own simple governments , usually revolving IN a miners ’ NN that regulated claims . Technically lacking in any genuine legal foundation , the miners ’ courts did maintain the minimal order needed for the mineral exploitation of the territory to continue . The unreliable mining operations soon gave NN to larger , highly capitalized and relatively permanent lode mining operations . The pioneers recognized that the vast mineral resources of the Rockies MD form the foundation of a thriving JJ NN , but the NNS settling there needed a more formal NN of laws and NN . The Congressional designation of JJ western NNS and territories had been bogged down for several NNS as southern and northern politicians fought over whether slavery MD be permitted in the JJ western regions . text: When I was a NN , my father was a family physician . Occasionally he talked about dreams with his patients or neighbouring peasants . Having overheard their chat , I joined in CD day , saying , “ I dreamed of walking on the street but I was aware that I was dreaming . So I was looking for some kind of bed to VB back to sleeping . It was a frustrating experience trying to find a bed in the streets of a village . I finally came to a JJ dark stone with a smoothly polished JJ NN . I fell asleep or out of the dream RB before my body touched the stone . ” They were all surprised by my dream , since lucid dreams are much less common for adults than NNS . In a lucid dream , the dreamer is aware of the dreaming status . He or she therefore participates in or RB manipulates the outcome of the dream . In my NN , I wanted to end the dream , and eventually I did . A JJ awakening , in which the dreamer dreamed of getting up to work or to VB to the washroom , is likely a lucid dream . A daydream MD RB be a lucid dream , if the dreamer goes far away from his waking NN of NN and is unaware of his physical and JJ environments . Since a lucid dreamer can often manipulate the imaginary experiences in the dream environment , lucid dreams can seem extremely real and vivid , depending on a person ’s level of self - awareness during the lucid dream . Recently , various techniques have been developed to induce lucid dreams . Such techniques apparently reduce the frequency and severity of nightmares . Both Buddhism and Taoism have RB been VBN to introduce lucid dream experiences in order to calm down the believer ’s NN . CD sect of Buddhism goes further to classify the JJ NN or consciousness into seven levels of awareness . There are degrees of wakefulness or awareness , and both lucid dreaming and normal waking experiences lie somewhere towards the middle of this continuum ( or hierarchy ) of awareness . In this context as the Buddhist believes , there are therefore NNS of wakefulness that are superior to normal waking awareness , such as Nirvana , which Buddhists pursue in their religious practice . In such superior awareness , the reality of our ordinary NN becomes illusory . Buddhism holds the view that NN on NN is bitter in nature . Closing his famous essay All Things Being Equal , Chuang Tzu VBZ , “ Chuang Tzu once dreamed that he was a butterfly fluttering here and there , VBG wherever he pleased . He was totally unaware of Chuang Tzu . A sudden awakening left nothing else but Chuang Tzu himself , who did not VB anything about his being a bufferfly . text: Stuart Turner ( born Bournemouth , Dorset , England ) is an English alternative blues singer . He now lives in Medway , Kent . Having released CD solo albums , Turner formed the band Stuart Turner & The NNP NNP Society , who release their 5th album Scowl in the summer of 2017 . Though being an active musician for a number of NNS , and playing with a number of JJ local musicians , Turner 's JJ official solo release came on NNP Pier Records , a Chatham VBN record label distributed by Cargo , and formed by friend and fellow musician Kris Dollimore , ex-guitarist with The Damned . Turner produced Dollimore 's debut NNP Pier release ( 02/01/1978 ) in 2006 , writing a song on it ( " The North Kent Post Industrial Hillstomp Blues " ) which received national airplay on BBC Radio CD . Turner 's own solo appeared a few months later with his debut album , A Gallon of NNP Makes a Mile of Fog , which CD critic described as " packed full of ideas " . [ 2 ] Turner supported Dollimore in gigs IN England and spent 2006 and 2007 playing shows in a diverse selection of venues , including bowling alleys , cabaret clubs and Swedish festivals , which CD reviewer described as " scaring the living daylights out of the assembled crowd with his spooky folk blues " . [ 3 ] Turner 's second album , File Under Carnal NNP , was described a freight train riding back bar room down at heel blues " , [ 4 ] and released on NNP Pier in February 2009 . Turner formed The NNP NNP Society with guitarist Robbie Wilkinson in 2009 to record what became the band 's JJ album Gin & Bitters . Alongside Turner and Wilkinson in the original line - up were Ray Hunt on drums and Dave Sawicki on bass ( with occasional trumpet from John Whitaker ) . The album was released on CD and digital download in July 2010 , through the independent Brigadier Records . The band added " steam driven NN " to his " anguished urban blues " , [ 5 ] and provided the opportunity for live performances IN the South East of England , including the Lounge On The Farm festival . Turner & The NNP NNP Society performed gigs to the end of 2010 , including a Christmas ball at Oxford NNP . A live version of " Murder On Gaslight Street " was made available for free download via Medway Eyes in October 2010 , whilst Brigadier Records released the Gin & Bitters album tracks , " Shimmy " and " South NNP Blues " as radio promos in December that NN . Gin & Bitters was followed up with the limited vinyl EP release Weekend Hearts in 2011 before the band recorded On The Brink Of Misadventure , which was their final album release with Brigadier Records . At this point , the band underwent some line - up NNS , with a JJ line - up containing Turner , Wilkinson , Nick Rice ( bass ) , Bob Collins ( guitarist formerly with The Dentists ) , Rob Shepherd ( from The Singing Loins on banjo , mandolin and accordion ) and James Kerr recording a JJ album during 2013 . At this point , the band began their association with Vacilando ' 68 Recordings in Autumn of 2013 and acquired publishing through Bucks Music Publishing . The JJ album , The Art and NNP of Phrenology : a presentation by Stuart Turner and The NNP NNP Society was released by Vacilando ' 68 in February 2014 . Steve Moore replaced James Kerr as drummer in NN for a JJ EP , The Gentleman 's Club , released by Vacilando ' 68 in October 2014 . Whilst recording what MD become the band 's 4th album , the band gigged extensively IN the South East and London and started to make in - roads into the grass roots festival circuit , with an appearance at 2015 's Bearded NNP festival a particular highlight . The 4th album , eponymously named , was released to critical acclaim by Vacilando ' 68 in April CD following a JJ period of artwork and pressing delays . The band had a CD - page feature in Maverick Magazine . With Mike Sewell replacing Steve Moore on drums , the band recorded their 5th album , to be released as Scowl in 2017 . The album RB features guest appearances from Rachel Lowrie and David Read ( of The Claim ) . Some left - over songs from the album were released as a digital only release in February 2017 . • On The Brink Of Misadventure ( 2012 , Brigadier ) • The Art and NNP of Phrenology : a presentation by Stuart Turner and The NNP NNP Society ( February 2014 , Vacilando ' 68 )

text: Nick Davies is a distinguished reporter who specialises in very JJ and depressing stories for The Guardian on subjects most other journalists prefer to leave untouched , such as poverty and the failings of the criminal justice NN . He has now turned his virtuous investigative eye on his own profession . His reaction is almost spinsterish in its horror . Davies ' notion of what journalists and journalism are for is idiosyncratic , to put it mildly . Whoever VBD him that this is an industry ' supposedly dedicated ' - as he puts it in his prologue - ' to telling the truth ' ? Where did he VB the idea that journalists should be , or ever have been , reluctant to lie , cheat , deceive and resort to low tricks of every kind ? In this survey of what he calls ' a corrupted profession ' , he hardly bothers with the tabloids . ' No NN needs a book to tell them that the tabloids are an unreliable source of NN about the NN , ' he comments with lordly condescension . Sheltered from the rough NN of daily hackery , he RB disdains what he sees as the fictions of objectivity and neutrality . Journalists , Davies believes , must make judgments ; the strong implication is that these should be between good and bad . Much of his analysis is nevertheless compelling and alarming . On provincial papers , pitifully underpaid journalists spend their days rewriting press releases , while the proceedings in courts and councils VBP largely unreported . At all levels , the relentless pressure on staffing , combined with the demand for more and yet more ' NN ' , have created a culture of dependence . Journalists with no NN either to find stories or to check the NN they are given , are reduced to processing the unstoppable flow of material from the PR departments , the special interest groups , the pseudo - experts , the pseudo - researchers . Davies convincingly chronicles the success of the NNP and MI6 in planting fictions across the supposedly independent NN to VB backing for JJ assessments of the dangers posed by Iraq and Iran . He argues that Greenpeace and other eco groups have been just as eager as the fossil - fuel lobby to distort and exaggerate the available NN on JJ NN to further their own ends ( although , curiously enough , Davies omits any reference to the willingness of his own newspaper to swallow the most extreme predictions of the coming catastrophe with scarcely a flicker of scepticism ) . His last three chapters focus on The Sunday Times , The Observer , and The Daily Mail ( The Sunday Telegraph does not draw Davies 's fire ) . It comes as little surprise to find that the Mail is prejudiced against blacks , homosexuals , immigrants , lefties , NNS on benefit and so on , and that it is unscrupulous in mobilising its NN and NN to hound them ; or that Davies laments the passing of the old investigative tradition on The Sunday Times . But his assault on The Observer is something else . In the eyes of Guardian men IN Nick Davies , their sister paper The Observer and its then editor , Roger Alton , committed an unforgivable offence in declaring support for the Iraq NN . Davies directs a venomous attack on the integrity and professional competence of Alton and his JJ editor , Kamal Ahmed . He portrays them as puppets of Alastair Campbell and Tony Blair , intent on turning the paper into a mouthpiece for the NN 's NN policy , ready to suppress or bury any story that might raise doubts about Saddam Hussein 's alleged NN . Of Alton , Davies VBZ : ' His passions are far from NN , much closer to sport and women , both of whom he pursues with obsessive NN ' - a comment so unpleasant that PRP begins to suspect some ancient personal grudge . Davies deliberately underplays the extent to which Alton was prepared to allow NN and NN to the expression of anti-war sentiment ; and ignores altogether the persistence with which The Observer criticised Blair and his ministers over their domestic record , and exposed their bullying , lies and deceptions . If this travesty of what happened at The Observer represents Nick Davies 's idea of good journalism , he can keep it . Let 's be charitable and regard it as an aberration , and concentrate instead on the valuable and disturbing insights that Davies provides into a business that needs to ask a good JJ questions of itself . No NN should expect journalists to be as high - minded as Nick Davies . Theirs is - or should be - a murky , occasionally mucky , job done by NNS short on scruples and RB on curiosity , suspicious of everything and everybody , and of favours most of all . Journalists do n't VB to be clean but they must be allowed to VB the story , and they must have the confidence and courage to write it as they VBP it . If we lose that , we 're all in trouble .

text: Image : CBC NNP : Sunday ’ sinterviews 9/11 Commission co-chair and co-author of the book “ Without Precedent : The Inside Story of the 9/11 Commission ” Evan Solomon : Tell me why you felt the NN , with Thomas Kean , to write this book “ Without Precedent ” ? Lee Hamilton : We felt we had an important story to tell , 9/11 was a traumatic event in our history , every adult in NNP will remember exactly where they were on that day when they heard the NN . We felt that the Commission ’s work gave a lot of insights into how NN works , and particularly how NN in the national security area works . We had hundreds of NNS tell us , or ask us , how the Commission did its work , and so we responded by writing the book and tried to let NNS VB the story , the inside story of the 9/11 Commission . Solomon : Do you consider the 9/11 Commission to have been a success , and if so , under what ways do you measure that success ? How do you call it a success ? Hamilton : The 9/11 Commission was created by statute . We had CD responsibilities – RB , tell the story of 9/11 ; I VBP we ’ve done that reasonably well . We worked very hard at it ; I do n’t VB that we ’ve VBN the definitive story of 9/11 , but surely anybody in the future who tackles that job will begin with the 9/11 Commission Report . I VBP we ’ve been reasonably successful in telling the story . It became a best seller in this country and NNS showed a lot of interest in it . Our second task was to make recommendations ; thus far , about half of our recommendations have been enacted into law , the other half have not been enacted . So we ’ve got a ways to VB . In a quantitative sense , we ’ve had about 50 % success there . In a qualitative sense , you MD judge it JJ JJ ways . But we still have some very important recommendations that we VBP have not yet been enacted that should be . Solomon : Now , CD of the stipulations , you write in the book , CD of the ways that you thought that this ought to be successful , this report , the Commission Report , is on page 23 , you VBD if the JJ NNS MD accept the results as authoritative , and the recommendations . And when I measure that against a Zogby poll done in NNP , that VBZ now 42 % of Americans VBP that “ the U.S. NN , and its 9/11 Commission , concealed or refused to investigate critical NN that contradicts the official explanation of September 11th , saying there ’s a cover - up ” – 42 % , Mr. Hamilton – what does that VB to you about the efficacy of the Commission ’s report ? Hamilton : Well , it ’s dispiriting , it ’s an unusually high number , but if you look at polls judging NN reports in the past – the Warren Commission , the reports on Kennedy assassination , RB the reports on Abraham Lincoln ’s assassination – you find a very high level of NNS who are skeptical . And you have that in this NN . When you conduct a major investigation , you cannot possibly answer every question , you just do the best you can . But for every question you leave unanswered , you create an opening to a NN NN , and a good JJ of them have popped up here . The only thing I ask in the future is that the NN NN NNS do not apply a double standard . That is to VB , they VBP us to make an airtight NN for any assertion we make . On the other hand , when they make an assertion they do it often on very flimsy NN . But conspirators are always VBG to exist in this country . Tom Kean and I got a flavour of this everytime we ’d walk through an audience – they MD hand us notes , hand us papers , hand us books , hand us tapes , telling us to investigate this , that or the other . You cannot possibly answer all these questions , you just do the best you can . Solomon : Some of the families have joined that chorus . We ’ve talked to CD father who VBZ , ‘ my son was killed by George W. Bush ’ , as if the NN had foreknowledge of the attacks . What MD you VB to someone IN him and other family members who have been dissatisfied with the explanation ? Hamilton : JJ families supported the report – very strongly – and have been instrumental in helping us on the implementation stage . A lot of the NNS that have doubts about the report – not all of them – are strongly anti-Bush , for a variety of reasons . JJ of them are just anti-government , in other words , they do n’t VB anything the NN VBZ . All I ask of these NNS is : give me your NN . If you thought George Bush or Lee Hamilton or Tom Kean blew up those buildings , let ’s VB the NN . Solomon : I MD n’t VB just .. there ’s a few things , but I VBP to VB , interestingly enough , if you ’ve seen a film that ’s so popular now on the internet , ten CD NNS apparently have seen a film called Loose NNP , which makes some startling allegations . It ’s a film made by three very young students out of a NNP NNP NNP . Have you seen that movie , and if so , what are your thoughts on it ? Hamilton : I have not seen it . Solomon : Yeah … CD CD NNS , I mean , some of them .. now , and it ’s interesting that you write in CD of your chapters , I VBP it ’s Chapter 12 , deals specifically with NN NNS . CD of them , as you VBP – probably CD of the most persistent – is that the buildings were brought down by controlled explosion , controlled demolition . CD of the bits of NN that is often cited is the collapse of NNP Trade Center Building Number 7 , which was not hit by any plane . CD question that NNS have is : why did n’t the Commission deal with the collapse Building 7 , which some call the smoking gun ? Why did this collapse at all ? Hamilton : Well , of course , we did deal with it . The charge that dynamite , or whatever , brought down the NNP Trade Towers , we of course looked at very carefully – we find no NN of that . We find all kinds of NN that it was the airplanes that did it . Do n’t take our word on that : the engineers and the architects have studied this thing in extraordinary detail , and they can tell you precisely what caused the collapse of those buildings . What caused the collapse of the buildings , to summarize it , was that the super - heated jet fuel melted the steel super - structure of these buildings and caused their collapse . There ’s a powerful lot of NN to sustain that point of view , including the pictures of the airplanes flying into the building . Now , with regard to Building 7 , we VBP that it was the aftershocks of these CD huge buildings in the very near vicinity collapsing . And in the Building 7 NN , we VBP that it was a NN of flames setting off a fuel container , which started the fire in Building 7 , and that was our NN on Building 7 . Now we ’re not the experts on this , we talked to the engineers and the architects about this at some length , and that ’s the conclusion we reached . Solomon : Let me just ask you CD more question on that . CD counter - argument – or there ’s CD , I guess – CD is that that fire very rarely , and has never , forced buildings constructed IN the NNP Trade Centers to ever collapse , because steel does n’t melt at NNS that can be reached through a hydro - NN fire , and that there ’s other .. in other words , there are countless NNS of other buildings that have been on fire that have not collapsed . Hamilton : – but not on fire through jet fuel , I do n’t VB you have any NN of that . But here again , I ’m not the expert on it . We relied on the experts , and they ’re the engineers and the architects who examined this in very great detail . Solomon : A question which has remained : Why did the debris of NNP Trade Center 7 , of which nobody died there , so there was no real urgency to move the debris away , and that there have been questions : why was n’t it examined closer ? Why was essentially NN from what MD have been a crime scene – or was a crime scene – removed very quickly from there ? Hamilton : You ca n’t answer every question when you conduct an investigation . Look , you ’ve to got to remember that on this day , chaos and confusion were the mark , and peoples ’ overwhelming concern was to try to save as JJ lives as possible , not to explain why a particular building collapsed . So it ’s not unusual to me that we , and the Commission – and anybody else , for that matter – cannot answer every question . I VBP back to what I VBP earlier : whenever you conduct an investigation , you cannot answer every question . Solomon : But should the Commission have .. I guess the question some NNS keep asking , should the Commission have asked more questions about the removal of the debris ? Hamilton : Look , you can VB that about almost every phase of our investigation , ‘ you should have asked this , you should have asked that , you should have spent more NN ’ – you ’re conducting an investigation , you have a NN limit , you do n’t have unlimited NN , you have a budget limit , you cannot VB down every track , you cannot answer conclusively every question . The members of the families that you referred to a minute ago submitted 150 questions to us – we answered a good JJ of them , we did n’t answer them all . You come to a point in an investigation where you have to VB to yourself , ‘ what ’s our responsibility , given the resources we have , how much can we do ? ’ And you end up with a lot of questions unanswered . Look , I ‘ve got a lot of unanswered questions in my NN . Solomon : What are yours ? What are your unanswered questions ? Hamilton : Well , at the top of my list happens to be a personal NN , and that is , I MD never figure out why these CD fellas did what they did . We looked into their backgrounds . In CD or CD NNS , they were apparently happy , well - adjusted , not particularly religious – in CD NN quite well - to - do , had a girlfriend . We just MD n’t figure out why he did it . I still do n’t VB . And I VBP CD of the great unanswered questions – a good topic for investigative reporters – MD be : why did these CD do what they did ? We speculated in the report about why the enemy hates us , but we simply were n’t able to answer the questions about the CD . Solomon : You VBP , just on that point , and again , there are so JJ of these questions about the CD . There have been some questions about – and I ’m talking about sources here IN the London Times and Le Figaro , sort of major newspapers – that some of these guys , some of these hijackers were still alive after the day of the event , that there are reports of their whereabouts . What did the Commission make of those kind of reports ? Hamilton : ( Laughs ) What ’s the NN ? Look , I had a woman come up to me who VBD she was a lover of Mohammed Atta . And I VBD , ‘ do you VB that he ’s dead ? ’ And she VBD , ‘ I ’m his lover . ’ .. ( raises eyebrows ) You VBP all kinds of comments IN this , you ca n’t trace everything down . Solomon : Where there any notion there was … The NTSB recently released the flight path of NNP Flight 93 in the past CD weeks . CD of the interesting things that that showed was , during the flight path , and I VBP the flight path of that , I VBP that plane crashed , according to the Report , at 10:03 am . And CD of the interesting things it showed – this is just recently declassified – that it flew well over 10,000 NNS – 30,000 , 40,000 NNS – from about 9:30 onward . Now , a lot of the cell phone calls that were made from that plane , that ended up being in the movie , were from , you VBP , NNS phoning from the plane . And CD allegation that ’s recently come out since the release of that is : cell phones do n’t work above 10,000 NNS , so how MD NNS VB on their cell phone on a plane and phone their relatives ? Hamilton : I ’m no expert on that . I ’ve been VBN cell phones work – sometimes – above 10,000 NNS , and as high as 30,000 NNS . So it MD have been that some of the calls went through and some did n’t , I just do n’t VB . Solomon : Let me ask you another thing . I ’m just asking because , you VBP , in the wake of this , there ’s lots of these questions . Solomon : The Lamont Doherty NNP Observatory at Columbia NNP , which is about 20 odd NNS away from NNP NNP , they released a report on seismic NNS coming from Manhattan on that day . And they released a spike in seismic NNS at 8:46:26 , and they thought that was the moment of impact of the plane on the JJ NNP Trade Center , of NNP Airlines 11 . But the plane did n’t hit until 8:46:40 , and there are several of the same kind of early seismic spikes for the second flight . I guess the question is : how do we explain those discrepancies ? When the NN looks at that , how can we explain that kind of thing ? Hamilton : I have n’t seen that report . I do n’t VB the answer to your question . They did n’t come forward with that NN while we were at the Commission – so far as I VBP . Now , staff filtered a lot of these things , so not necessarily MD I VB . I do n’t VB what happened with regard to the… . What did they conclude ? I do n’t VB what they concluded . Solomon : They had no conclusion ; the NN is sitting out there . You write about , in Chapter 12 of the book – and again it ’s CD of those allegations that have come up – about who had foreknowledge of it ? CD piece of NN that JJ critics have VBN is : ‘ well , there is lots of ‘ puts ’ – which is a form of financial NN trading . In other words , NNS are buying up NN , hoping that the airline NN MD plunge , and there was an unusually JJ number of puts on NNP Airlines and NNP NN , and therefore NNS profited from this . What did you make of that NN ? Hamilton : That ’s CD we did investigate . We looked at that pretty carefully , and all I can indicate at this point is that we do not VB anybody profited from manipulation of airline NN prior to 9/11 , there ’s no NN of that , I do n’t VB . Hamilton : That ’s correct . It ’s not unusual in the NN NN to have a lot of activity in a given NN , or industry , as you did here . The question is : did any of them have foreknowledge and profit from it ? We do n’t VB so ; we looked at it pretty carefully . Solomon : There ’s RB allegations that the Pakistani Secret Service , called the ISI , the head of which met here in the NNP NNPS RB before 9/11 , and there ’s some allegations and NN to show that they paid Mohammed Atta $ 100,000 . The reason this is important is : who funded the NNS who conducted the attacks , the terrorist attacks ? What did the Commission make of payment from the ISI to Mohammed Atta of $ 100,000 ? Hamilton : I do n’t VB anything about it . Solomon : Was there any connection between .. Did the Commission investigate any connection between ISI , Pakistani intelligence , and .. Hamilton : They MD have ; I do not recall us writing anything about it in the report . We MD have but I do n’t recall it . We did estimate that Osama bin Laden spent about $ 500,000 for the 9/11 attacks . We did not identify all the sources of that NN . Solomon : And how it got to the … Hamilton : That ’s JJ , you simply can’t trace it , so far as I VBP , because $ 500,000 in international financial markets is not RB a blip on the radar screen . So we do not VB precisely where that NN came from . Solomon : Questions about foreknowledge , especially as to when Vice NNP Dick Cheney knew when he went down to the protective bunker : there was some suggestion that the Secretary of Transport Mineta testified in front of the Commission that he in fact talked to Dick Cheney at 9:20 am . Cheney claims he had n’t been there .. gotten down there until close to CD am . That was eventually omitted from the final report , . Can you tell us a bit about about what Secretary of Transport Mineta VBD the Commission about where Dick Cheney was prior to CD am ? Solomon : And we do n’t VB exactly where that .. Hamilton : Well , we VBP that Vice NNP Cheney entered the bunker shortly before CD o’clock . And there is a gap of several minutes there , where we do not RB VB what the Vice NNP RB did . There is the famous phone call between the NNP and the Vice NNP . We MD find no documentary NN of that phone call . text: • The legendary investor Warren Buffett avoids making predictions , but we 've gathered 12 of his best guesses about cryptocurrency , table tennis , and RB his own death . • We 've detailed each prediction and assessed its accuracy in the slideshow below . The legendary investor Warren Buffett knows better than to make predictions . " We have no idea - and never have had - whether the NN is VBG to VB up , down , or sideways in the near - or intermediate - term future , " he wrote in his 1986 letter to Berkshire Hathaway shareholders . Yet the Oracle of Omaha MD n't resist making a few guesses about the future over the NNS . We 've gathered 12 of his most intriguing predictions and assessed their accuracy in the slideshow below . " In terms of cryptocurrencies generally , I can VB almost with certainty that they will come to a bad ending , " Buffett VBD in an interview with CNBC in January 2018 . " Now , when it happens or how or anything else , I do n't VB . " He added : " If I MD buy a five - NN put on every CD of the cryptocurrencies , I 'd be glad to do it , but I MD never short a dime 's worth . " Buffett has been JJ about cryptocurrencies so far . At the NN of his prediction , bitcoin traded above $ 14,000 . The cryptocurrency slumped below $ 4,000 by the end of 2018 , and it's now trading at about $ 5,200 . " Ships will sail IN the NN , but the NNP NNP Society will flourish , " Buffett VBD in a speech at Columbia 's business school in NNP 1984 . Buffett MD have been making a point about stubborn denialism in financial markets , but his prediction about so - called JJ - earthers was correct - they 've enjoyed a resurgence in recent NNS . " It is fitting that the visit of Halley 's NNP coincided with this percentage gain : neither will be seen again in my lifetime , " Buffett VBD Berkshire Hathaway shareholders in 1985 after the conglomerate grew its net worth by 48.2 % . He RB predicted that the 23.2 % compounded annual growth in the NN 's per-share book value that NN was " another percentage that will not be repeated . " It took nearly 20 NNS for Buffett to prove himself wrong on the JJ count . Berkshire Hathaway 's net worth jumped by 48.3 % in 1998 , though that was largely because the NN issued shares for acquisitions . " Normally , a gain of 48.3 % MD call for handsprings - but not this NN , " he VBD investors . Buffett 's second prediction was RB off the mark . Berkshire Hathaway 's per-share book value rose by 23.3 % in 1986 . It has RB grown by at least 23.2 % in more than CD other NNS since 1985 . Buffett VBD students at the NNP of Kansas in NNP 2005 that Sears Chairman Eddie Lampert MD struggle to revitalize the department - store chain . He warned that rivals such as Walmart and Costco MD undercut Sears , which had just been acquired by Kmart . " Eddie is a very smart guy , but putting Kmart and Sears together is a tough hand , " Buffett VBD . " Turning IN a retailer that has been slipping for a JJ NN MD be very difficult . " Buffett was JJ on the NN . Sears filed for bankruptcy protection in October . However , some hope remains : Lampert recently won NN approval to buy the 126 - NN - old retailer out of bankruptcy and escape liquidation . " We expect to keep permanently our three primary holdings , Capital Cities / ABC , Inc. , Geico Corporation , and The NNP Post , " Buffett VBD Berkshire Hathaway shareholders in his 1986 letter . " RB if these securities were to appear significantly overpriced , we MD not anticipate selling them , just as we MD not sell NNP 's or Buffalo Evening NNP if someone were to offer us a NN far above what we VBP those businesses are worth , " he added . Despite his best intentions , Buffett can't resist a great deal . Berkshire Hathaway sold its stake in Capital Cities / ABC to The Walt Disney NNP in 1996 in a cash - and - NN deal worth $ 2.5 CD . He RB flogged his NN 's 28 % stake in The Post to Graham Holdings in a deal worth more than $ 1.1 CD in 2014 , according to the newspaper . The Graham family sold The Post to Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos in a $ 250 CD deal in 2013 . Berkshire Hathaway remains a major investor in Geico , NNP 's Candies , and The Buffalo NNP . " In 1988 we made major purchases of Federal Home Loan Mortgage Pfd. ( ' Freddie Mac ' ) , " Buffett VBD Berkshire Hathaway shareholders in his letter that NN . " We expect to hold these securities for a JJ NN . In fact , when we own portions of outstanding businesses with outstanding managements , our favorite holding period is forever . " Luckily for Buffett , he changed his NN . Berkshire Hathaway sold nearly all its Freddie Mac and Fannie Mae shares in 2000 , slashing its holding to 0.3 % from 8.6 % in 1999 . Buffett VBD the Financial NNP Inquiry Commission in 2010 that he had become " concerned " about the NNS ' management . " They were trying to and proclaiming that they MD increase earnings per share in some low double - digit range or something of the sort , " he VBD . " And any NN a JJ financial institution starts promising regular earnings increases , you 're VBG to have trouble , you VBP ? " " No sensible observer - not RB these NNS ' most vigorous competitors , assuming they are assessing the matter honestly - questions that Coke and Gillette will dominate their fields worldwide for an investment lifetime , " Buffett wrote in his 1996 letter to Berkshire Hathaway shareholders . " Indeed , their dominance will probably strengthen . Both NNS have significantly expanded their already huge shares of NN during the past ten NNS , and all signs point to their repeating that performance in the next decade . " Buffett 's claims have proved sound so far : Both Coke and Gillette remain the biggest players in their markets , though the latter is under mounting pressure . Coca - Cola 's share of the US soft - drinks NN was 41 % in 1991 , compared with Pepsi's 33 % , and outsold its archrival fourfold in overseas markets , according to The NNP NNP Times . Its share of the JJ carbonated - beverage NN was nearly 49 % in 2015 , according to Statista . In contrast , Gillette 's NN share has fallen from about 70 % in 2010 to 54 % in CD in the face of fierce competition from startups including the Unilever - owned Dollar Shave Club and Harry 's , according to a report from the NN - tracking firm Euromonitor cited by The Wall Street Journal . Buffett is notoriously skeptical that the good times will continue . In Berkshire Hathaway 's 1999 letter to shareholders , Buffett and Charlie Munger , his partner , deemed it a " virtual certainty " that the S&P 500 MD " do far less well in the next decade or CD than it has done since 1982 . " Buffett was JJ that the S&P 's stellar average total return of just over CD % from 1982 to 1999 MD n't last . The index returned an average of 1.2 % over the next decade , according to SlickCharts , recovering to a respectable 12.2 % from 2010 to 2018 .

text: As David Crosby has proven NN and NN again , there ’s no question he ’s unwilling to answer . He ’s RB made more than his share of mistakes throughout his JJ NN , which is why he was the perfect person to become Rolling Stone ’s newest advice columnist . In his second “ Ask Croz ” column , Crosby takes on anti-vaxxers , open marriages , and finding meaning in your NN after devastating loss . I ’ve been married for 15 NNS , and I ’m starting to feel pretty bored . I VBP the only NN this can work in the JJ run is if my wife agrees to an open relationship . How do I broach this topic without her VBG insane ? Can open marriages work ? — Evan , Raleigh , North Carolina No . I VBP that because I tried it . Look , I ’m the guy that wrote “ Triad . ” I tried it , VB me . I tried it every which NN . What happens is we ’re imperfect beings and we VBP jealous of each other and if you ’re VBG with CD JJ girls , CD of them is VBG to VB jealous of the other NN . It happens almost every NN . I VBP NNS that have done it for a number of NNS and they have balanced each other . But generally , when a guy wants an open marriage , he just means he wants to VB laid and he wants permission to scout RB and hit on other girls . You ca n’t do that . It ’s not VBG to work . I mean , you can do it , but your love is never VBG to love you and trust you . You ’ll never VB to the level that I ’m at with my wife , where she trusts me . She knows I ’m not VBG to screw RB because I have n’t done it in 42 NNS and I ’m not VBG to start now . My sister refuses to vaccinate her kids . She ’s worried it ’ll VB them to be autistic . I ’m worried they are VBG to VB NNS or worse . MD I be wrong to take them to a NN without her knowing ? I VBP a NN who ’ll do it . — Summer , Portland , Oregon This is serious business . The anti-vaxxers are wrong . They are absolutely wrong . Their NN is incorrect and vaccinating NNS does not VB NN . Period . NN is an entirely JJ thing . Read Steve Silberman ’s book [ NeuroTribes : The Legacy of NNP and the Future of Neurodiversity ] and you will understand NN a lot better . NNS who are selling the anti-vaxxer nonsense are the same NNS who VBP the NN is JJ . They are just ignorant and wrong . And the problem comes in when you ’re in inflicting this on someone else . You ’re saying your kid ca n’t have the medicine , but you are pushing your ignorance and stupidity on your kid and that can hurt them very , very badly . But that ’s not the worst part . The worst part is you can VB a whole bunch of other NNS to VB sick . That is an irresponsibility I can hardly countenance at all . I can’t . There is n’t any NN I can find any forgiveness in my heart for NNS that do that . It is utterly stupid . All of the NN contradicts it and you ’re doing great harm . text: Most of the dinosaur skeletons you VBP in museums exist because of sedimentary rocks . These fossils got their start when a dinosaur died in an environment that had lots of moving sediment , IN an ocean , riverbed or lake . CD such place is the benthic zone -- the deepest part of a body of NN . This sediment quickly buried the dinosaur , offering its body some protection it from decomposition . While the dinosaur 's soft parts still eventually decomposed , its hard parts -- bones , teeth and claws -- remained . But a buried bone is n't the same thing as a fossil -- to become a fossil , the bone has to become rock . The organic parts of the bone , IN NN cells , collagen ( a NN ) , and fat , eventually break down . But the inorganic parts of the bone , or the parts made from minerals IN calcium , have more staying NN . They remain after the organic materials have disappeared , creating a fragile , porous mineral in the shape of the original bone . Other minerals reinforce this bone , burning into a fossil . NN gradually makes its NN into the bone , carrying minerals IN iron and calcium carbonate picked up from the surrounding sediment . As the NN penetrates the dinosaur 's bones , some of these minerals precipitate into their microscopic pores . As this process continues , the bone becomes more and more rocklike . It 's IN filling a sponge with glue -- the sponge 's physical structure stays the same , and the pores and pockets within it fill up . The glue makes the sponge sturdier and more resistant to damage . JJ , thick bones , which have more room for mineral glue , make better fossils than JJ , JJ bones . Over the course of millions of NNS , the sediment IN these reinforced bones becomes sedimentary rock . Erosion , tides and other natural processes continue to deposit more sediment , and this sediment becomes rock , too . As RB as they can withstand the pressure from the surrounding rock , the bones remain safely hidden and preserved . After millions of NNS , some natural process , IN the gradual shifting of the NN 's NN , can reveal these layers of rock and the fossils they contain . Sedimentary rock can RB hold trace fossils , which record an organism 's behavior . Some of the most well - VBN trace fossils are trackways , or the tracks of extinct animals . These form when an animal leaves its prints in soft but sturdy soil , which creates a mold . This mold fills with sediment , and both the mold and its filling harden over millions of NNS . Forces IN erosion remove the upper layers of rock , revealing the preserved footprints underneath . Sediment can RB fill the mold and harden into a cast , or a reproduction of the NN that made the print . This can happen with other traces , too , IN burrows and tunnels . Some other trace fossils include coprolites ( fossilized dung ) tooth marks on bones or wood , and nests . Sediment can RB preserve plant NN . Plants can make impressions in hardening sediment or become petrified wood after VBG through much the same process as fossilized dinosaur bones do . This type of fossilization creates sturdy fossils , but it can only take place in specific conditions . Next , we 'll look at the other ways NN forms can be buried , encased or otherwise protected so their remains last millions of NNS .

text: U.S. Treasurys prices rose and yields eased on Thursday as an ongoing contest in NNP that has shut much of the NN and left the debt ceiling problem unresolved inspired investors to buy U.S. debt , still the most viable safe haven . Given the gridlock over the budget and healthcare reform that led to a partial NN shutdown that began on Tuesday , investors are increasingly worried the lawmakers will not agree on a deal to increase the statutory $ 16.7 trillion borrowing limit by the Oct. 17 deadline . Failure to increase the debt ceiling , they fear , MD unleash NN chaos and damage the JJ - term creditworthiness of the U.S. NN and the safe - haven status of the dollar . " At this point , the NN seems to have a pretty high degree of confidence the Treasury will not miss or delay a principal or interest payment — that other things will give before that gives , " VBD Robert Tipp , chief investment strategist at Prudential Fixed Income , with $ 400 CD in assets under management , in Newark , NNP Jersey . " But if that assumption comes into question you will VB the orderly repricing that is VBG on RB now become disorderly , " he VBD . " For the NN , any significant doubt as to the timely payment of interest or principal on Treasury securities MD be tantamount to the NN ceasing to rotate on its axis . " As concerns over a possible U.S. default have intensified , the cost to insure Treasurys has soared in the credit default swaps NN , though analysts qualify that by noting that that NN is not particularly broad or deep .
