text: From the left , Rick Berke , Helen Branswell , Juliette Kayyem and Michael Mina discuss the NN outbreak at an Institute of Politics Forum at Harvard ’s Kennedy School of NNP . CAMBRIDGE , Mass . — For a veteran epidemiologist , an authority on homeland security , and a JJ NN reporter , the outbreak of the novel NN is the type of emergency they had RB anticipated . But now that it is here , the three experts VBD Friday , they still MD n’t VB but feel the monumentality of what they were watching unfold . “ It ’s the most daunting NN that we ’ve contended with in half a century or more , ” Michael Mina , an epidemiologist at Harvard ’s T.H. Chan School of NNP NNP , VBD at a panel discussion Friday at Harvard ’s Kennedy School of NNP . Helen Branswell , STAT ’s infectious diseases and JJ NN reporter , has covered emerging pathogens since the 2003 NNP outbreak . But with the JJ NN , Branswell VBD during the panel , “ It ’s bizarre but I find myself startled . Having written about the possibility of something IN this for NNS , I still find myself RB startled that it ’s happening , and I do n’t VB why that is . ” She compared the circumstances now to the summer of 2014 , when Ebola was racing through West Africa and the NN did n’t seem to have a plan to stop it . “ Except that I never worried then about Ebola spreading in the city I lived in , ” she VBD . “ It ’s JJ now . ” As the panel was occurring , the Cambridge - VBN drug NN Biogen VBD that top executives had been at a meeting at a Boston hotel last week that was RB attended by eight NNS who later tested positive for the NN , which causes a NN that authorities have named NNP - CD . The NN asked JJ employees to work from home for the next CD weeks . In introducing the Harvard panel , Mark Gearan , director of the Kennedy School ’s Institute of Politics , which hosted the event , directed students and others at Harvard to JJ travel policies the NN issued on Friday , just before the panel started . They included a ban on NN - related international travel and “ non-essential ” NN - related domestic air travel , and discourage personal international travel . “ We strongly discourage any non-essential meetings or events of 100 NNS or more , ” the email to the campus read . ( Institute of Politics staff members RB put more than the usual NN between chairs in the audience . ) Panel moderator Rick Berke , STAT ’s executive editor , asked the crowd of roughly 100 NNS if any of them had considered not coming to the event . A few raised their hands . “ Do I VB that this is a bad idea ? ” Mina VBD when asked if the panel should be held . “ I VBP we ’re hitting the NN in the course of this epidemic where we might consider that this should be CD of the last types of events IN this . ” Here are some highlights from the event . Why this NN is JJ The spread of the JJ NN has been compared to influenza , which RB causes a respiratory illness . But , as the panelists pointed out , there are no drugs or NNS yet for treating or preventing the NN , VBN as NNP - NNP - 2 , as there are for NN . In addition , we are exposed to JJ NN strains throughout our lives , which VBP us build immunity . No NN had immunity to this JJ NN . “ We have an entirely susceptible population , ” Mina VBD . “ The potential for this to burn through a population very quickly is very high without extraordinary measures . ” As researchers race to VB the NN , they are finding that it does not seem to be infecting great numbers of NNS , or at least making them very sick . ( Experts IN the globe are still trying to figure out just how broadly the infection has spread , given that JJ mild NNS are likely to be missed . ) But it is causing serious harm to older NNS and those with underlying diseases or weakened NN systems . “ This NN , on the CD hand , there ’s a saving grace that it does n’t seem to be impacting our young , and that is amazing , ” Mina VBD . “ But the mortality rate among NNS who are getting infected above 80 NNS old is 15 - plus % . ” How to mentally prepare for this NN If you plan for the disruptions that the response to the NN MD require , it will seem less unexpected when schools are canceled or you ’re VBN to work from home , advised panelist Juliette Kayyem , the faculty chair of the Kennedy School ’s homeland security program and a JJ homeland security official at the NN and federal level . “ VB your head IN this is practical , ” she VBD . “ It ’s here , there are VBG to be massive disruptions to our JJ fabric in terms of your day to day . All of you have a part in stopping the spread of this … but we have to treat this as part of the plan . We ’re at that stage now . ” Unlike with a natural disaster or terrorist attack , “ we do n’t have a boom moment , ” she VBD , and the NN was more slow rolling . “ When do you activate ? ” she VBD . “ That ’s sort of the challenge RB now . ” Kayyem , who worked in the Obama administration , RB made the point that the response will be a patchwork . Some schools will close , others will remain open . The federal NN ’s bungled rollout of testing for NNP - NNP - 2 , which has limited how JJ NNS can VB tested for the NN but is now being remedied , did not inspire much confidence in the U.S. response initially . But Kayyem VBD that as NNS are detected in more places , it will largely be on local and NN agencies . She described the NN as “ locally executed , NN managed , and federally supported . ” As for how to judge whether the response is working : “ The bad thing has happened , it ’s coming , it ’s here , ” she VBD . “ We ’re in the response phase . Our measure of success is not containment anymore . Our measure of success now is , will fewer NNS die or VB severely sick because of our efforts ? ” It ’s not just the NN that has a role to play , she VBD . Universities , the NN , and employers VBP to act responsibly . Individuals RB have to VB involved , whether it ’s staying home if they are not feeling well or making sure they have had the NN shot . After all , if they can avoid getting the NN , that frees up NN for NN care providers to deal with NNP - CD NNS . Mina VBD the fragmented U.S. NN care NN leaves him worried about the cohesion of a response . “ I do n’t VB to sound defeatist here , but the NN of our NN care NN , the NN we have privatized everything about it for the most part , is VBG to seriously impact our ability , ” he VBD , adding that , “ we have no ability to create out of the blue JJ hospital beds . We ca n’t RB test appropriately . ” “ If we ca n’t figure how to run some PCR instruments because we can’t work together as a society — this is within networks , within hospitals , within the national NN , everything — I RB am very concerned about this in a NN that far exceeds our concerns for other viruses and other pathogens , and the most vulnerable are the elderly . ” The response in NNP , where the NN RB emerged and NNS quickly exploded , included the unprecedented steps of essentially quarantining tens of millions of NNS in and IN Wuhan , the city at the center of the outbreak . text: A half CD NN old hammer embedded in rock that formed 400 CD NNS ago . In June 1936 Max Hahn and his wife Emma were on a walk beside a waterfall near to London , Texas , when they noticed a rock with wood protruding from its core . They decided to take the oddity home and later cracked it open with a hammer and a chisel . What they VBD within shocked the archaeological and scientific community . Embedded in the rock was what appeared to be some type of ancient NN made hammer . A team of archaeologists analysed and dated it . The rock encasing the hammer was dated to more than 400 CD NNS old . The hammer itself turned out to be more than 500 CD NNS old . Additionally , a section of the wooden handle had begun the metamorphosis into coal . The hammer ’s head , made of more than 96 % iron , is far more pure than anything nature MD have achieved without assistance from relatively modern smelting methods . In 1889 near Nampa , Idaho , whilst workers were boring an artesian well , a JJ figurine made of baked clay was extracted from a depth of 320 NNS . To reach this depth the workers had to cut through fifteen NNS of basalt lava and JJ other strata below that . That in itself does not seem remarkable , until PRP considers that the very top layer of lava has been dated to at least 15 CD NNS old ! It is currently accepted by NN and geology that coal is a by - product of decaying vegetation . The vegetation becomes buried over NN and is covered with sediment . That sediment eventually fossilises and becomes rock . This natural process of coal formation takes up to 400 CD NNS to accomplish . Anything that is VBN in lumps of coal or in coal seams during mining , had to have been placed or dropped into the vegetation before it was buried in sediment . In 1944 , as a ten NN old boy , Newton Anderson , dropped a lump of coal in his basement and it broke in half as it hit the floor . What he discovered inside defies explanation VBN upon current scientific orthodoxy . Inside the coal was a hand crafted brass alloy bell with an iron clapper and sculptured handle . When an analysis was carried out it was discovered that the bell was made from anunusual mix of metals , JJ from any VBN modern alloy production ( including copper , zinc , tin , arsenic , iodine , and selenium ) . The seam from whence this lump of coal was mined is estimated to be 300,000,000 NNS old ! A hand crafted bell VBN in a 300 CD NN old lump of coal ! These extraordinary discoveries although bizarre , are not unique or RB uncommon . There are literally thousands of them collecting dust , locked away from JJ scrutiny in the vaults of museums throughout the NN . There are JJ other unusual reported finds including the following : The Morrisonville , Illinois Times , on June 11 , 1891 , reported how Mrs. S. W. Culp VBD a circular shaped eight - carat gold chain , about CD inches JJ , embedded in a lump of coal after she broke it apart to put in her scuttle . The chain was described as “ antique ” and of “ quaint workmanship . ” Displayed in a museum at Glen Rose , Texas , is a cast iron pot reportedly VBN in a JJ lump of coal in 1912 by a worker feeding coal into the furnace of a NN plant . When he split open the coal the worker VBD the pot fell out , leaving its impression in the coal . Yet another report VBN in the Epoch Times VBD of a Colorado rancher who in the 1800 ’s broke open a lump of coal , dug from a vein some 300 NNS below the NN , and discovered a “ strange - looking iron thimble . ” The Salzburg Cube is yet another ancient puzzle VBN by a worker named Reidl , in an Austrian foundry in 1885 . IN the others , this NN broke open a block of coal and VBD a metal cube embedded inside . Recent analysis established the object was of forged iron and obviously hand crafted . The coal it was VBN in was millions of NNS old . The list of such items goes on and on and on . Welcome to the NN of Ooparts , or Out of Place Artefacts . Out of place artefacts ( Ooparts ) are so named because conventional scientific wisdom ( an oxymoron if ever there was CD ) VBZ that these artefacts should n’t exist VBN upon currently accepted beliefs regarding our origins and history . These discoveries are “ out of place ” in the orthodox timeline of JJ history . The usual methods of the conformist scientific community , when faced with such anomalies is to attempt to debunk their reported age , or perhaps endeavour to discredit the source of the report or RB the reporter . If this approach fails then usually the artefacts themselves are banished to the shadowy vaults of museums and warehouses , never to be seen again . If these unusual artefacts were “ CD offs ” then perhaps PRP MD be forgiven for accepting the view espoused by the mainstream scientific and archaeological community that they are hoaxes or misreported stories . However , when PRP realises that thousands upon thousands of these anomalous artefacts have been discovered and reported over the NNS , then PRP MD VB to re-evaluate ones acceptance of the integrity of mainstream archaeology and NN . Occasionally an honest archaeologist will attempt to reveal to the NN the JJ age and origin of such anomalous objects . They will question the accepted beliefs of their mainstream peers . They usually find that their career ends quite abruptly . Unfortunately , the majority just accept what they are taught in school and NN without question . That is how our educational NN is designed . It does not encourage individuality and originality . It purely indoctrinates CD with established beliefs and dogma . If PRP requires NN of this “ mainstream ” mentality , CD NN look no further than the realms of psychiatry . Modern psychiatry seeks to demonize and declare mentally ill anyone who deviates from what is regarded as the norm . These so called “ mental NN professionals ” have RB invented a JJ mental disorder named Oppositional Defiant Disorder , or ODD ( love the irony of the abbreviation ) . This newly invented condition is listed in the latest instalment of the industry ’s Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders , or DSM , which dubs NNS who do not conform to what those in charge declare to be normal , as mentally insane . So there you have your proof – I ’m obviously an unmitigated nutter and completely insane . At least that is what those in authority MD VB everyone to VB ! On CD side of the field we have the Darwinists and their NN of evolution , trying to establish the extremely flawed view that we have somehow evolved into highly intelligent sentient beings from a primordial blob of gunge , miraculously brought to NN by an electrical storm billions of NNS ago . ( Perhaps CD of this cults followers MD explain to me when “ consciousness ” evolved , and provide proof – I await with baited breath ! ) On the other side we have the creationists with the belief that some omnipotent invisible being who lives in the clouds , waved his magic wand about 7,000 NNS ago and created the NN and everything on it . Again the adherents of this equally flawed NN rely on nothing more than a book called the Bible for their “ proof ” of this concept . The fact that this book has been bastardised during translation numerous times during its existence , has been re-written to certain individuals personal preference on a number of occasions , and has had JJ complete chapters omitted , is irrelevant to its followers . All they require is “ faith ” . Proof and NN is not a prerequisite ! PRP MD n’t VB more opposing beliefs if CD tried , and both camps adhere to their beliefs voraciously , and with unshakable fervour . Yet neither are VBN on any kind of factual or hard NN . The reality is that the origin of the JJ race is a total enigma . No NN , anywhere , actually knows how old humanity is or how and where it originated . It is a complete mystery . text: CD day during the past summer , at the end of a JJ uphill beat after the partridges , I threw myself breathless on the ground , and on my back waited for the others to come up . As they drew near , five or six strong , tramping heavily through the turnips , I was struck by the apparent tremor of the NN beneath me . It was shivering IN a jelly — or I was ; for a moment I was in doubt which . Spreading out my hands upon the NN and lying as dose and JJ as I MD , l was soon made sure that the tremor was RB in the NN and not in me . It grew more and more distinct , keeping NN with the tramp of the walkers . When at last they reached me I VBD them of their Neptunian feat , and , them jump altogether a few yards off , was gratified to find that I MD thus bring about a. very respectable earthquake at will . The motion was very peculiar , and I can well VB that a queasier stomach than mine MD soon be conscious of something very IN a ^l de terre . We examined the structure of this skipping hill , hut VBD nothing that helped us much to an explanation . It was mainly made up of a thick cap of gravel on a base of red sandstone , and so was not likely to contain anything IN a high - arched hollow or concealed morass within . This vivid little experience made me readier , perhaps , than some to accept the striking statements about NN shaking made by the brothers Darwin at the NNP meeting of the British Association . Especially was I prepared to give credit to what they quoted from the Astronomer Royal about Greenwich Hill and the Observatory . He wrote : ” In the old times of Greenwich Fair , some twenty NNS ago , when crowds of NNS VBD to run down the hill , I find the observers MD not take reflection observations for CD or three hours after the crowd had been turned out . . . . We do not have anything IN such crowds now , RB on bank holidays , and 1 have not heard lateiy of any interference with tile observations . ” ' ' There is as little foundation for the calumnious hypothesis that the observers whose reflections were thus agitated had been visiting the fair themselves as for the suggestion that the above experience of my own took place after luncheon . No . the truth is the solid NN is a very elastic solid after all , and Greenwich HiU and the Observatory and all that it contained were trembling IN my Highland knoll . The hOWdah of the Atlas elephant that stands on a tortoise , is a rather rickety structure , and quakes with every jog of the Titanic beast . But is it not being tugged at by every petty planetoid , pulled from its path by every NN , heaved all awry through its yielding bulk by NN and NN in their courses ? It is ; but over and above these longer , graver motions there are incessant tremblings and quiverings in quick periods , measured by seconds or less . This unlooked for sensitiveness to JJ stresses , this incessant vibration when all obvious disturbing causes are eliminated , are the JJ facts that the Darwins have so strikingly brought out . How solid rock and massive piers of stone warp under heat and cold IN unseasoned wood ; how a wide stretch of ground MD swey and rise for hours together after a little NN has been poured on it ; how the passage of a train VBZ away or the pressing of a finger on the ground near at hand MD be enough to deflect the plumb line to a visible degree — these and JJ other JJ phenomena are detailed in the full and most interesting preliminary report on the Lunar Disturbance of Gravity , handed in to the Section of Physics by the ingenious brothers . The title reminds us that , as so often in NN . it was in looking for CD thing that they VBD another . Every CD knows that as the NN pulls the NN round in its monthly orbit , so , too , the NN . pulls the NN and everything upon it . If a plummet be hung up RB under the NN , so to speak , the NN is drawing the bob downward , the NN very much more feebly pulls it upward . The result is that the bob weighs a trifle lighter than if the NN were abolished . Thanks to the NN , the string is leM severely strained . If the NN be not RB overhead , but down a little toward its rising or its setting point , the bob will be a little drawn aside out of the straight and the plummet will no longer give a JJ plumb line . As the NN rises , crosses the sky , and sets , then the direction of the plumb line will VB through a JJ angle . Of course , RB when no NN is seen , its silent influence must be felt , and the plumb line will return to its position by the NN the NN is ready to rise again . How JJ the NN RB is we MD gather from the fact that with a plummet three hundred yards RB , the travel to and fro of the bob MD scarcely II this country reach a thousandth of an inch . This is what is meant by the lunar disturbance of the direction of gravity : and there must , of course , be a solar disturbance RB , the same in kind , but naturally very much smaller in amount . To investigate these disturbances experimentally clearly calls for refined skill and very delicate apparatus ; but Sir William Thomson , to whom instrumental difficulties are always but NN 's play , in suggesting the investigation three NNS ago , had in view the detection of an influence still more recondite and refined . I have VBN that the NN , in pulling aside the bob of the plummet , pulls RB on the NN beneath it . If the NN were perfectly stiff and unyielding , this pull MD have no effect on the deflection of the plumb line . But if , as we have reason to VB , the NN yields IN a great viscous mass to great stresses as well as to JJ ones , a hump of solid NN — a land tide — will travel round the globe in obedience to the NN 's attraction . This hump in its course will pass under the suspended plummet , and the actual deflections of the plumb line as observed will no longer agree with those reckoned on the supposition that the NN is rigid . If we had an instrument , then , by which the minute aberrations of a carefully suspended pendulum , isolated as far as possible from all local disturbance , MD be magnified up to the point of visibility , we should have it in our NN • “ On an Instrument for Detecting and 'Measuring flmall NNS in the Direction of Gravity . ” By George H. Darwin . M.A. , F.B S. , late Fellow of Trinity College , Cambridge , and Horace Darwin , M.A. , A.M.I.l:.lS. British Association Report . 1881 .to settle some very pretty points in the physical NN of the NN . Such an instrument , after various trials and fail - ures . the Darwins have erected in the Cavendish Laboratory at Cambridge . A massive stoue , weighing three - quarters of a ton , is bedded in a pit upon the native gravel . It is surrounded by a trench , a NN wide , to isolate it completely from the floor and the building . The pendulum is a massive cylinder of pure copper , hung by a brass wire about a yard RB . inside a hoRow cylindrical copper support that rises from the stone . A tiny galvanometer mirror is hung by CD fine threads , CD of which is fastened to the bob and the other to a projection of the fixed support . This suspension is so arranged that any movement of the hob displaces the mirror to a much greater degree . A ray of light is sent from a distant lamp on to the mirror , and thence reflected to a scale seven NNS away . The magnification resulting from this double process is something IN 50,010 times . To still and quench accidental tremors , the hollow copper cylinder is filled up with a mixture of spirits and NN . It is a fact , ^^e out hy Poiseuille , that a boiled mixture of ginand NN is much more viscous and clogs the motions of bodies immersed in it much more effectually than either the neat gin or the simple NN . Further to ward off the effect ' of external NNS of NN , the whole instrument is immersed in a tank of NN resting on the stone ; and lastly , after the precedent of the Tisbbite , tile surrounding trencb is RB filled up with NN . Thus protected , tbe apparatus might seem sufficiently cut off from local influences , but as a fact its sensitiveness is now so great that tbe observation has to he carried on in another room by means of a window and a telescope . Standing in the room itself sixteen NNS away , it is enough to shih youi ' weight from CD NN to the other to VB the speck of ligbt to run along the scale . The same result follows if you pre^ steadily with your fingers on the stone edge of the trench , but you MD strike a good sharp blow RB on the stone base without effect . It is the distor - sion of the soil by slight steady pressure that is transmitted through solid gravel aud stone and shows itself as a microscopic deviation of the pendulum . Such being the NN , the instrument should he deiicate enough , in all conscience , to determine lunar and RB solar disturbances in the direction of gravity ; but , unfortunately , having got so far , we seem almost to have done too much . When regular series of observations are made it is VBN that the pendulum is hardly ever steady . The image on the seale dances about inceiMantly . The ground is never RB still . Some days it MD bequieter than others , and generally there is NN of distinct diurnal periods , but the minor zigzags constantly interrupt and at times reverse for an hour together the slower march northward or southward . These tremors have been hitherto so persistent and so wildly irregular that for the present , at least , the prospect of unraveling from them the perturbations due to the NN does not seem very near . Mr. George Darwin talks of the probable necessity of building a gravitation observatory at the bottom of a mine . There , it MD be hoped , the rail NN train and the NN cart will cease from troubling , and the plummet , save for Ihe steady paces of the NN , will be at rest . The work of examining and observing these tremors of the NN is , however , still VBG on at Cambridge , and idrcady several sharp seasons of microscopic earthquake , unsuspected outside , have been noted . Sometimes a very storm of tremor breaks out for which no sufficient local NN can be traced - . RB so far , the outcome of these experiments MD prove of high value to practical astronomers . The piers on which their great telescopes turn are built of solid stone , hitherto regarded as the material most insusceptible to NN or disturbance . The Darwins have shown that such piers are RB most sensitive to inequalities of NN and to JJ stresses . They yield and warp to a most unexpected degree . Tbeir had conducting NN is responsible for this in part , and it is fruitfully suggested that it might be well to plate the piers with coppenand to swathe them wi*h flannel . Astronomers , who , to their vexation . have to redetermine the level of their instruments from hour to hour , and who have RB suspected the occurrence of microscopic earthquakes , will take note of this practical hint .. They will make ready use , too , of the observation here recorded as to the effect of the observer 's own weigbt . They will VB more of the drainage of the soil IN their instruments after the observation on the irregular and JJ - continued swelling of ' the ground that results from the percolation of NN . Meanwhile the British Association and Cambridge MD be congratulated ( in the JJ and valuable , field of work thus opened out under their au. ; pices , and especially on their having enlisted the services and energies of CD workers who so worthily keep up the tradition of an honored name . — London Times .

text: Deep NN Rising : The Mainstreaming of the Shadow NNP It goes by JJ names : The shadow NN . The deep NN . The secret team . Whatever it is called , the idea is simple : there is an unelected , unaccountable , largely unknown group behind the facade of the visible NN that wields NN and works toward JJ - term agenda goals no matter which JJ party or puppet politician holds office . JJ the domain of the dreaded “ NN theorist ” community , the idea has surfaced here and there over the NNS . The JFK assassination has given rise to JJ inside accounts and outside exposés of The Secret Team . The Iran -Contra scandal led to a NNP Moyers documentary on The Secret NNP that is still worth watching CD NNS later . It was RB openly acknowledged that a “ shadow NN ” had kicked into operation on 9/11 . But an odd phenomenon has taken place in recent NNS and intensified in recent months : the idea of a “ deep NN ” or a “ shadow NN ” controlling politics , RB in the US , is becoming mainstream . It has graced the cover of any number of recent books , including “ Deep NN : Inside the NN Secrecy Industry ” and “ The Deep NN : The Fall of the Constitution and the Rise of a Shadow NN . ” It has VBN its NN into the JJ JJ NN from both the left ( Salon ) and the NN ( The JJ Conservative ) ends of the controlled JJ spectrum . It has been invoked by mainstream financial analysts to describe the actions of the Federal Reserve . It has been revisited by NNP Moyers on his website . It has VBN its NN into the headlines of The Boston Globe ( “ Vote all you VBP . The secret NN wo n’t VB “ ) and the NNP NNP Times ( “ NNP ’s ‘ Establishment ’ Has Embraced ‘ Deep NNPS ’ “ ) . Heck , it has RB been talked about on the NNP Bank ’s blog . This onslaught of attention begs the question : why now ? Why are so JJ mainstream outlets suddenly shining a light on something that has barely been acknowledged in the past ? To be sure , some of this recent coverage is a whitewash , as you MD expect . The NNP Bank blog , for instance , pawns the concept off as something to be VBN in “ newish democracies ” in “ Latin NNP , Africa , Asia , Eastern Europe and so on , ” i.e. , not in the West . This qualification –that the “ deep NN ” idea is something only to be VBN in foreign , backwards polities –harkens back to the origins of the phrase . The term “ deep NN ” itself is a translation of a Turkish phrase , derin devlet , that rose to prominence after the Susurluk incident exposed the Turkish secret NN and its NATO / Gladio / drug running / terrorist associations . It has become increasingly allowable for opinion makers in the MSM to cite the Turkish or the Egyptian “ deep NN ” as a real phenomenon ( or at least a real possibility ) while simultaneously deriding the possibility that it exists in the West . However in recent NNS researchers IN Peter Dale Scott have developed and expanded the concept to explain how Western JJ institutions function . This seems to have been picked up by NNS IN Mike Lofgren , a retired Congressional staffer who has described how the JJ deep NN involves a cross-party consensus on key JJ issues , or Philip Giraldi , the JJ intelligence agent whose recent musings on the JJ deep NN received copious attention from the mainstream press . CD NN to look at this development is as an extension of a phenomenon that I noted several NNS ago : a process of indoctrination that has begun to inform the NN that there is a shadowy elite in NN of the NN stage and prepare them to accept that fact . Nearly a decade ago Kissinger mini-me David Rothkopf came out with his book “ Superclass ” revealing the group of 6,000 or so non-state actors with the ability to enact policies and further agendas across NN lines . Since that NN a remarkable number of conspiracies - that - dare - not - be- mentioned from the CFR to the Bilderberg Group to the Bohemian Grove are now banal JJ talking points . Whereas mainstream radio hosts once played Twilight Zone music when callers tried to discuss the CFR , now Hillary NNP blithely admits that the NNP Department receives marching orders from them ; whereas the Bilderberg Group was once subject to a complete NN blackout , it now has its own website and press releases . But again : why now ? Partly this has to be due to the fact that in the post - 9/11 , post - Iraq , post - bailout , post - Hope and NNP NN , it has become impossible to maintain the illusion that it is the JJ front men who are running the show . No NN believes this lie anymore , and it shows . RB scientific studies are now demonstrating that the NNP NNPS is not run by JJ parties but by pockets of special interest . Truly the NN toothpaste is out of the tube and there ’s no point in trying to put it back . While in JJ ways this represents the crowning achievement of the tireless efforts of generations of NN researchers who have toiled in relative obscurity , it is not an unmitigated good . As we will VB in the CD prospective this weekend , the revelation of the ruling elite coincides with a meltdown of JJ cohesion that is giving rise to dark forces that portend a very tumultuous NN . In the meantime , I ’m interested in your thoughts on this subject . Why do you VB the “ deep NN ” idea is being taken up in the mainstream now ? Do you VB there is a strategy to these revelations or is it a rearguard effort to whitewash the undeniable ? Corbett Report members are invited to leave your comments below .

text: A NN who believes NNP is JJ , and was ready to launch himself from a rocket in California on Saturday afternoon to prove it , has canceled his plans . At least for now . Not having the required federal permits plus mechanical problems with his " motorhome / rocket launcher " forced self - taught rocket scientist " Mad " Mike Hughes to put his experiment on hold . The U.S. Bureau of Land Management ( BLM ) " VBD me they MD not allow me to do the event ... at least not at that location , " Hughes VBD in a NNP announcement , amid international attention over his plans to launch into the ' atmosflat . ' " It 's been very disappointing , " he VBD . Hughes is a 61 - NN - old limo driver who has spent the last few NNS building a steam - powered rocket out of salvage parts in his garage . text: The following essay is reprinted with permission from The Conversation , an JJ publication covering the latest research . Ancient and quaint seem the days of witch crazes , demon scares and tulip manias . Instances of mass hysteria MD strike you as rare events in modern advanced societies . But such outbreaks are NNS of their times . They ’re still RB today , just in JJ guises . Aided and abetted by its status as an internet meme , the myth of an evil , supernatural Slenderman has been panicking adolescents since 2009 , RB culminating in an attempted murder by proxy . If it ’s easy to brush this off as a NN of impressionable teens with too much internet access , then what of otherwise rational late 20th - century JJ adults participating in suicide cults , Puerto Rico ’s mythical cattle - killing Chupacabra monster , the “ irrational exuberance ” of the dot - com bubble in the 1990s , or the seemingly insane rush to make bad real estate investments in the latter 2000s ? As this article is being written , the U.S. is embroiled in a diplomatic dustup with Cuba that has all the classic NNS of a collective delusion . The U.S. NNP Department claims its diplomats in Havana were subjected to “ sonic attacks ” that produced a range of physical NNS including hearing loss , headaches and dizziness . Consequently , the NNP Department pulled out most of its embassy staff and sent packing most Cuban diplomats stationed in the U.S. Although post - hoc JJ exams have identified unusual physical conditions in some diplomats , there is still no direct NN tying them to the alleged sonic attacks . Moreover , the JJ timing , logistical demands and absence of a plausible technology put the likelihood of the attacks at virtually zero . So how do otherwise logical and informed 21st - century NNS fall under the spell of these mass delusions ? Over the past several decades , psychologists and sociologists have VBN examples IN these to dig into when and how this kind of JJ belief gains traction . Collective delusions are the culprits behind mass hysterias and related phenomena . As traditionally defined , they ’re characterized by a rapid , spontaneous and temporary spread of JJ beliefs within a circumscribed population . Nowadays that circumscribed population can be a virtual NN , bounded only by cyberconnections to a shared source of misinformation . The recent upsurge in vocal JJ - NNP proponents , for example , is not the result of geographical neighbors whipping each other into a near frenzy . JJ NN makes it easy to find IN - minded others , serve distorted NN to the curious , and stir up excitement about events such as the 2017 eclipse , celebrity endorsements , and a proposed rocket launch by a JJ - NNP proponent intended to prove once and for all that we are all living on a disc . Collective delusions emerge under a combination of several conditions . Each of these precursors is straightforward enough , but it ’s harder to foresee when they might occur in concert . In turn , this makes predicting delusional outbreaks a very inexact NN . The most obvious precursor is the presence of multiple NNS who are sufficiently connected so as to share NN or experiences . Second , just as an isolated individual MD develop some beliefs and behaviors that depart from prevailing norms , collective delusions and responses are more likely to occur in relatively insular groups or networks . Third , a collective delusion is more likely to take hold if the group is undergoing some kind of distress . This MD be rising unemployment , JJ destabilization or an enemy ’s threats of warfare . On a smaller scale , a town MD lose a crucial employer , or a fire - and - brimstone minister can instigate a satanic panic with rumors of baby - killing cults . And fourth , the stressors are potent enough to trigger , in at least some individuals , either a psychosomatic response or scapegoating behavior . Psychosomatic reactions — physical NNS with psychological causes — MD be as mild as itching or as severe as blindness . Scapegoating involves blaming a group of innocent ( or possibly nonexistent ) others for causing problems — psychosomatic or otherwise . When conditions are ripe , this catalyzing subset of group members sets off a chain reaction . They begin to seek and identify external causes for their distress , or sources for its relief . Psychosomatic responses spread ; contempt for the scapegoats grows . NNS become hypervigilant and toss critical thinking out the window , looking for and finding imagined threats . NN NNS are spawned , angels and demons invoked , fears stoked , panic induced . The supernatural MD start to seem natural . As more and more group members become ensnared in a positive feedback loop , the perceived threat is legitimized , only broadening and deepening JJ distress further . Because they are inherently newsworthy , mass delusions are picked up by mass NN which fan the flames RB more . In these ways , a nonexistent threat can set off a self - sustaining cascade of irrationality that lasts until the perceived threat recedes . Delusion everywhere , to JJ degrees ? While descriptions of mass hysterias make great reading , they represent only the far end of a continuum of what sociologists VBP me call JJ diffusion processes . For the most part , these are quite mundane — you might recognize a few from your own daily NN . While IN the NN NN NN bubbles and bank runs make NN , less frenetic responses to perceived threats and conspiracies abound : the 9/11 “ truthers , ” the recent uptick in JJ - NNP beliefs , fears of gluten and genetically modified foods , NN NN deniers , wars on NN on some liberal college campuses , and more . RB the desire to be fashionable can be seen as a response to the fear of being excluded . Simple mathematical equations can quite elegantly describe the speed , duration and extensiveness of the spread of beliefs and behaviors . A typical “ diffusion model ” shows how the penetration through a population of such things as beliefs , behaviors , illnesses , innovations or NNS is determined by just a few parameters . These typically include the group ’s size , the density of its members ’ interconnections and the inherent contagiousness of the thing being spread . Irrational beliefs , and the often ill - considered responses they engender , can spread IN an infection across groups as JJ as nations or as JJ as nuclear families . Sunshine , as they VBP , is the best disinfectant . JJ impact NN MD suggest that the best approach to administering JJ disinfectant is via JJ numbers of geographically nearby , authoritative nonbelievers . In the NN of the supposed sonic attacks in Cuba , CD approach to stemming the scare MD be a rapidly deployed on - site investigation by acoustic experts , neurologists , psychiatrists and JJ strategists . A folklorist as well MD n’t hurt . Short of such a full - frontal counterattack , disseminating easy - to - digest skeptical NN as early as possible in the process MD VB to slow the diffusion process and quell the mass delusion . It ’s easy enough to be caught up in a mass delusion . Fads and fashions are great examples , though their most harmful consequence MD be our embarrassment when we look back on some of our previous style choices . As RB as NNS are stressed and living in groups , most of our mass delusions will remain invisible to us until they have already run their course . text: Taking into account the JJ factors that affect eyesight , as well as other considerations , the JJ eye can actually VB pretty far . • VBN on the curve of the NNP : Standing on a JJ NN with your eyes about 5 NNS off the ground , the farthest edge that you can VB is about 3 NNS away . • Detecting a candle flame : Researchers VBP that without obstructions , a person with healthy but average vision MD VB a candle flame from as far as 1.6 NNS . • Without the NNP ’s curve and from higher up : You might be able to identify objects from dozens , RB hundreds , of NNS away . It ’s things IN : • your eyesight , including the NN and function of the eye itself • the size of the object that you ’re viewing • the curvature of the NNP • any obstructions in your line of sight Let ’s take a look at these influences to understand how the JJ eye can VB as far as it does . The phrase “ visual acuity ” refers to the clarity of your vision . Experts consider normal , or healthy , visual acuity to be 20 / 20 vision . That simply means that you can clearly VB something 20 NNS away that you should be able to VB from that distance . If you have 20/100 vision , you MD still be able to VB an object clearly from 20 NNS away , but someone with normal vision MD VB it clearly from 100 NNS . Conversely , if you have 20 / 12 vision , you can VB something clearly at 20 NNS that most NNS VBP to be 12 NNS from to VB clearly . How does the eye process images ? When you look at anything , a rapid and complex sequence of actions will take place in the eye and brain : • Light reflects off an object and passes through the cornea , which is the transparent outer layer of the eye . • The cornea bends the light rays to allow them to enter the pupil , or the dark center of the eye . • At the same NN , the muscles in the iris — the colored area IN the pupil — VB the size of the pupil , making it smaller in bright light and larger in a darker setting . • Light rays then pass through the lens , which sharpens them as they reach the retina , the thin tissue layer at the back of the eye that contains tiny nerve cells VBN as rods and cones . • The rods and cones convert the light rays into electrical impulses , and these travel from the eye through the optic nerve to the brain , which converts them into images . Assuming that all of the body parts and processes that are necessary for clear vision are working normally , then the limitations on how far you can VB come down to : • the size of the object that you ’re viewing NNS often use the term “ sightline ” in a theater to describe the line of sight from an audience member ’s seat to the stage . But , a sightline is RB any uninterrupted visual angle from a person ’s eyes to what the person is trying to VB . Aside from obvious visual obstructions IN trees , buildings , and clouds , there ’s CD major factor that can reduce your sightline : the curvature of the NNP . The NNP curves about 8 inches per mile . As a result , on a JJ NN with your eyes 5 NNS or so off the ground , the farthest edge that you can VB is about 3 NNS away . If you were lying down on the beach with your head less than a NN off the ground , your eyes MD be able to VB about a mile out over the NN . However , if your vantage point were much higher off the ground , then the horizon line MD be a lot farther away . The curvature of the NNP MD n’t start to cut things off from your view quite so soon . The researchers decided that someone with healthy vision MD detect a candle flame from about 1.6 NNS away , assuming that there was no fog or other obstructions . The NN is about 238,900 NNS away , and it ’s easy to VB some of its craters , valleys , and plains on a cloudless night . RB closer to home , the view from Mount Everest in the Himalayas — the NN ’s tallest summit at about 29,000 NNS above NN level — offers a view of close to 211 NNS in every direction , according to a user - generated map . Due to the elevation though , clouds often obscure the view . text: The idyllic beaches on the island of Buoj where Marshall Islands NNP Christopher Loeak fished as a boy are already submerged , and the ever - encroaching ocean now threatens to wash away roads , schools and airstrips . " The end of the island gets shorter every NN . Some places we VBD to stand on the beach to fish are now in the NN , " Mr Loeak , 60 , VBD AFP . Buoj is CD of 52 islands in Ailinglaplap , an atoll that a Marshall Islands survey VBD was CD of its most vulnerable to NN NN . " I have great attraction to Ailinglaplap , " Mr Loeak VBD in the capital , Majuro . " I can live on other islands , but I was born and raised there . I always VBP about VBG back there to live . " The Marshalls , an island nation of some 70,000 NNS about halfway between Australia and Hawaii , will have a rare moment in the international spotlight in September , when it hosts the annual Pacific Islands Forum . " We will not stop telling NNS that NN NN is a real issue for humanity , " he VBD . " We will be the JJ to feel it , but it will come to them and they should realise it . " The warning was echoed by Barack Obama in a landmark speech , in which the US NN dismissed NN NN deniers and outlined steps aimed at making NNP a JJ leader in NN gas reduction . " We do n't have NN for a meeting of the NNP NNP Society , " Mr Obama VBD . " Sticking your head in the sand might make you feel safer , but it is not VBG to protect you from the coming storm . " The impact of JJ NN is starkly evident in Ailinglaplap , with the Marshall Islands ' senior NN NN advisor Steve Why saying the majority of the atoll 's shorelines were eroding . " Infrastructure at NN of eroding includes three airstrips , roads , causeways and schools , " he VBD . Why and his survey team documented coastal erosion as an increasingly serious problem affecting JJ of the atoll 's islands and noted the threat of rising NN levels to the entire country . " Strong northeast trade winds since October 2012 have elevated NN levels three - to - six inches ( 7.6 - 15.2 centimetres ) , noticeably accelerating erosion on Ailinglaplap , " he VBD . About 1,700 NNS are scattered on the atoll 's islands , which are barely a metre ( three - NNS ) above NN level , RB at their highest points . A causeway linking some of the islands is disappearing , while salt NN makes previously productive agricultural land useless . Why VBD discussions with the community showed NNS wanted the infrastructure problems fixed , but they were reluctant to confront the worst - NN scenario . " Most conversations stalled as we envisaged what the future held - over a three NN rise in average NN level during this century , and more beyond that , " he VBD . " ( It 's ) not difficult to imagine what will happen over the coming decades while standing , talking , sleeping and raising PRP 's family on land that is just a couple of NNS in elevation above the high tide mark - a line that is now always slowly moving inland - when there is n't anywhere else that 's easy to retreat to . " Mr Loeak VBD the fate of the low - lying nation raised questions about the basic JJ rights of those affected by JJ NN , warning that if the islands were ultimately engulfed by the ocean , " we become refugees " . Mr Loeak VBD that while he was happy to VB NN leaders such as Obama talking about NN NN , it had not changed the fact that NN levels were continuing to rise in the Pacific . text: It is stunning that I have to write this article , but I do . A popular rapper has launched a GoFundMe to prove that the NNP is JJ . Several professional basketball players have RB weighed in with their perspective . The picture of NNP below is pretty definitive , but there are basic meteorological " pieces of NN " too . Herein , I explore three of the most important ones . Sunsets : Have you ever watched a sunset ? If so , it is a compelling " duh " that the NNP is not JJ . If you observe the horizon at sunset , typically the NN disappears from your view in a bottom - up direction . In a very simple experiment described on the PBS website , This fact is how ancient sailors knew that NNP was spherical ( and the fact that they did not sail off of some mythical edge ) . As the NN falls increasingly below the horizon , more of the shorter wavelength light is scattered out as it travels through more of the atmosphere . This scattering leaves the longer wavelength colors of reddish - orange . General circulation of the atmosphere : It is intuitive to most NNS that it is warm in the tropical regions of the NN and cool in the polar regions . Because of the NNP 's curvature , the mid-section of NNP receives more of the direct radiation from the NN . This means that there is more heat concentrated in the tropical atmosphere and ocean . The NNP satellite maps below illustrate that this radiation imbalance is prevalent irrespective of season . The NNP is continually trying to remove the excess heat in the tropics . CD NN that NNP tries to put itself on a " heat " diet to remove excess heat in the mid-section is through poleward - moving ocean currents . A good example in the NNP NNPS is the Gulf Stream . It is a warm , poleward flowing current . Hurricanes are another mechanism that transports excess heat from the tropics to the poles . The general circulation of the atmosphere RB evolves because of the net imbalance of heating . In its simplest form , the air rises over the warmer tropics and sinks over the cooler polar regions . This is a thermally - direct circulation . In reality , it is a bit more complex as described on NOAA website , Since the NN rotates , the axis is tilted , and there is more land mass in the northern hemisphere than in the southern hemisphere , the actual JJ pattern is much more complicated . Instead of CD JJ circulation between the poles and the equator , there are three circulations . ( 1 ) Hadley cell - Low latitude air movement toward the equator that with heating , rises vertically , with poleward movement in the upper atmosphere . This forms a convection cell that dominates tropical and sub-tropical climates . ( 2 ) Ferrel cell - A mid-latitude mean atmospheric circulation cell for NN named by Ferrel in the 19th century . In this cell the air flows poleward and eastward near the NN and equatorward and westward at higher levels . ( 3 ) Polar cell - Air rises , diverges , and travels toward the poles . Once over the poles , the air sinks , forming the polar highs . At the NN air diverges outward from the polar highs . NN winds in the polar cell are easterly ( polar easterlies ) . This general circulation model is directly tied to JJ patterns of high - low pressure , jet streams , and NN systems . NN radar : I cut my teeth as a radar meteorologist . Some of my earliest graduate work at Florida NNP NNP developed NN radar algorithms to track hurricanes . I RB teach a radar and mesoscale meteorology course at the NNP of Georgia . CD of the fundamental concepts that we discuss is how curvature of the NNP impacts rainfall detection . The example at a National NNP Service website describes it well , A storm between the Birmingham ( BMX ) and Maxwell AFB ( MXX ) radars ( VB image below ) . If the storm is a good distance away from BMX , due to the fact that the radar beam is straight and does n't follow the NNP 's NN , the lowest elevation scan from BMX MD only be able to " VB " into the middle portion of the storm . If that same storm is closer to MXX , this will allow us to " look " into the lower portion of that same storm , possibly allowing us to detect a rotational couplet closer to the NNP 's NN . From this , we MD infer that given the JJ circumstances , the formation of a tornado is possible . By the NN , I still cannot VB I had to write this .

text: Mapping CD of the flattest parts of the NN will VB satellite calibration . A precise topographical map has been made of CD of the flattest places on NNP : the salar de Uyuni , a vast plain of white cemented salt in the mountains of Bolivia . The ground survey , aided by JJ positioning systems ( GPS ) , shows variations in elevation of less than a metre across an area almost half the size of Wales . Intriguingly , the work reveals bumps in the salt that lie above lumps of dense rock buried several kilometres below , just as NN will bulge over a bump on the ocean floor . Knowing exactly where these bumps lie will VB researchers to use the NN as a giant calibration device for satellite - VBN radar and laser altimeters . Adrian Borsa , a geophysicist at the US Geological Survey in Pasadena , California , led the work that is now reporting the most precise GPS characterization yet of the salt JJ , accurate to 2.2 centimetres . Borsa and his colleagues began the research in 2002 , with a campaign that combined NNS from fixed GPS stations with ‘ kinematic GPS ’ NNS obtained by crisscrossing the salar in trucks fitted with GPS antennae . “ It ’s as if you ’re on a white ocean with no waves , ” VBZ Borsa . “ You VBP the horizon , the curvature of NNP . It ’s absolutely featureless . ” The NN was commissioned specifically as a NN to calibrate NNP ’s ICESat , launched in 2003 to VB NN sheets in Antarctica and Greenland . Satellites can calibrate their altimeters by bouncing signals off the ocean NN , the height of which is well established . But because of atmospheric interference , tides and waves , there are uncertainties . Borsa VBZ the salar , now so accurately mapped and with dry , clear skies , is about five times better than the ocean as a reference point . The results have been helpful , VBZ Sinead Farrell , a researcher at the US National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration who is VBG ICESat to measure NNS in NN NN . “ It ’s the JJ calibration NN that we look at , ” she VBZ . “ The NN that they provide is useful to all the other teams . ” She adds that the salt NN is RB being VBN for Envisat , a European satellite , and MD be VBN to calibrate future orbiters such as Cryosat - 2 , a planned European NN - monitoring mission . Whereas the NNP - observing community likes the flatness of the salar , geologists are interested in the tiny undulations . The strength of gravity varies from place to place IN NNP — imperceptibly to NNS but in ways that NNS have mapped precisely — owing to the density of objects nearby . Borsa VBD that the salt had created faint mounds of some 40 centimetres in height over regions of slightly higher gravity , owing to high - density volcanic rocks kilometres below . “ We VBD a rare breed of topography , ” VBZ Borsa , who VBZ that this is the JJ NN a land NN has been shown to undulate in step with the gravitational field IN this . “ Here ’s a place where you VBP the imprint of the gravitational field due to buried mountain ranges . ” Borsa has a NN as to how this happened . When the salar floods , as it does every five NNS or so , salt dissolves and , in solution , flows to regions of higher gravity , he VBZ . This phenomenon is already VBN to oceanographers : the free - standing ocean NN VBZ slightly to match the pull of gravity underneath . So there are slight bulges in the ocean in places directly above submarine seamounts . “ We VBP that ocean surfaces follow the gravitational potential NN : the geoid , ” VBZ Farrell , who was not a part of the NN . “ It is a JJ result to show that the salt NN RB follows the geoid . ” The next step for those with a geological interest , Borsa VBZ , is to take out the portion of the elevation variations that are due to gravity and VBP what ’s left . So far , he is seeing a strange , regularly patterned checkerboard NN . He does n’t VB what MD produce it , but speculates that it MD reflect the imprint of periodic pressures due to prevailing winds . Working out the forces that produce this pattern MD be useful if similar phenomena are ever spotted on another NN , he VBZ . “ Now we ’ve got an analogue on NNP . ”

text: “ Community – How to live together ? How to communicate effectively ? Who knows how we ’ve experienced a sense of community in other dimensions , once upon a JJ NN ago ? I choose a direction North - South for ease of understanding dimensional shifts in sync with the term “ Ascension ” which means to JJ religious NNS “ rising up to the heavens ” with images illustrating a figure carried on the weightless substance of clouds . When rising above the quirkiness of personal styles in approach and awake and alert to the vagueness of presence and intention ( in virtual communications ) we can step forward and connect by addressing the issues that are rising within us , communicating our feelings and the experience of how actions of others affect us and how we feel our own actions affect others . By being informed about their impact on others who make an effort to offer feedback , honouring their own value as much as the value of the person on the other side of the screen , or table . The desire that PRP ’s presence matters in a community , can lead to JJ expressions , depending on a force of will , making a point for the sake of fanatism , a NN for attention or competition , by challenging an authority , or a warm - hearted service as a means to fulfilment of PRP ’s own desire in sync with PRP ’s desire to serve a general sense of wellbeing in all . Issues that are rising between 2 NNS , showing up in their CD - on - CD communication RB , or in the practice of working together in the physical NN , should best be kept in that close encounter of a duet . It takes CD to tango and not CD or more than 2 , for is n’t stepping on each other ’s toes sufficient NN to pay attention properly ? To me , it ’s an interesting subject to discuss community - creation and without expecting you or others here to address all of them , here are a couple of questions : – How does it look IN , your favoured community ? How MD you describe your NN in it ? – What makes or breaks a community ? – What ’s the difference in a virtual and physical community ? If there ’s CD at all . – What ’s causing members of a community to feel inspired and at ease ? – What ’s required to maintain a community in liveliness and sparkly vibes , open to NN ? – Should there be an intention and foundation on which a community is built and functioning ? – Should a community - to - be start with a gathering of NNS at random , spontaneously / casually formed ? – Is a community a work in progress , with a common interest showing up in due NN , which my become the core of an intentional community ? – Should a community grow organically , by a coming and VBG of members without a fixed plan for an “ end- product ” or “ end-result ? ” – Are members of a community open to leaving and trying out JJ forms of communities ? – Should a community be a living organism that is in motion and NN always . In the latter NN communication becomes a whole JJ concept , I imagine . To me , the form and subject of a chosen service are CD very JJ things . – Is transparency of decision making and reports of financial manoeuvers to all members of a community , who contribute financially , a must and a benefit ? There are questions about community living “ How to live together ? ” that countless JJ generations have pondered and discussed , forgotten , buried and dug up , dusted off and , at times , placed on an altar . NNP dominates the processing of the raw minerals , and has implied through its NN - controlled NN that it MD restrict rare earths NNS to the NNP NNPS , just as it did to Japan after a diplomatic dispute in 2010 . text: Come here , Imma gonna VBD you something . Gonna teach you about The Monster today ! Instead of my usual review of the week , I ’m VBG to put up for your reading pleasure , five of my articles you MD , or MD not have seen from the five hundred sum odd pieces the Tea Party Tribune has been kind enough to publish for me over the last three NNS . When you write an article you tend to VB it ’s a masterpiece . I bury “ Easter Eggs ” in every NN . A good example of that is in “ NNP Baby and The Trip To Bountiful , ” where in CD line I replaced “ The Principal ” with the words “ The Principle ” alluding to polygamy . It got by a lot of NNS but the principal who let my grandson VB skipping across Main Street in Brigham City got my point , and he ’s been mad ever since . Sorry for Party rocking Dude ! I RB include at least CD mistake for liberals who search my stuff to challenge my literacy . An it ’s for its or a comma for a period . For every fifty to CD hundred articles that are penned , PRP will be the “ monster ! ” While on a typical run an article will struggle for reads , these certain works will take off a bit faster . Then you ’ll notice a comment later on that article , but not from the Trib . It ’ll come from USA Today , or some other publication where part or all of the article was VBN or cited . That ’s when you VBP back and check the numbers and VBD article will move into the “ DAYUM ” section . These five are those types of works . I did n’t learn journalism in any college . I learned to spin a yarn in Nashville . The same methods that make a song “ cook ” will chicken fry an article . Methods UH make a point and return to it toward the end to reinforce the theme . Do n’t keep repeating “ ands ” and “ buts . ” Write IN you speak . I do n’t have a JJ problem with spelling because I ’m ignorant and do n’t use a whole lot of JJ words . I try not to lie . . . much , but I ’ll use innuendo to worm IN a subject or person ( such as that principal ) to make my point . FYI : The reason my five NN old grand baby got out in the street unsupervised was he was too infatuated with a certain teacher . Little light hearted jab on an embarrassing era of Mormon history , add a dash of innuendo and voila ! Principal soup ! But you VBP I ’m bad . While I ’m on that subject , I VBP to explain why I pick on Mormons so often . RB though I ’m an old “ Reptile Bait ” I ’ve been covered UP with Latter Day Saints for over thirty NNS . My wife ’s and for that matter my daughter in law ’s family are Temple Worthy all the NN back to Joseph Smith . I did write Joseph Did You VB about the Mormon culture , and I ’m fascinated with their history , but if I ever stepped into a Temple my hair MD catch on fire . I use the same method when addressing race baiters , JJ Correctness , and NNS who are confused by common sense . I read my stuff out loud . That ’s an old songwriter ’s trick . My friends VBP I ’m crazy because I always seem to be talking to myself . If it wo n’t roll smoothly off your tongue it will irritate or confuse the reader . Finding subjects to write about is not hard . I can actually write about things I VBP very little of . When I began to write for Raging Elephants Radio on Doc Greene ’s show I actually knew very little about the Texas movements of secession and nullification . In NN I learned , but for about six months it was mostly style , style , style . I do research . Usually on NNP . I will sometimes spend up to a week familiarizing myself with a subject before I write anything about it . CD subject I never MD RB cope with was the NNP NNP Society . I tried , but I simply MD n’t drink enough whiskey to make any sense out of it . I try not to rag on the Cartels or Muslims too much because I do n’t VB to VB bombed or shot . That all having been VBN , I VBP you will enjoy these pieces . IN a hit song I MD feel them coming off my pen , so to speak . Each NN directly addresses some facet of the JJ experience . Each NN promoted itself to the “ DAYUM ” status . I do n’t buy into inspiration but I will VB these five came out of nowhere , so I guess there is someone out there looking out for us . It has been my honor and my joy to share with you guys and gals . It is a collection of minds started by NNP the Butcher , a conservative op / ed journalist who began publishing forty NNS ago . We strive to make the articles informative , entertaining , and diverse . All you VBP will VB you to stop and consider . We try not to drone on with the same old day after day clap trap that MD have driven you away from mainstream NN . You will read things here that you will VB nowhere else . We are from London to Austin to the Escalanté . So , what ’s your cut of meat ? Shop RB . The Butcher Shop is happy to fill your order . The Liberty Beacon Project is now expanding at a near exponential rate , and for this we are grateful and excited ! But we must RB be practical . For 7 NNS we have not asked for any donations , and have built this project with our own funds as we grew . We are now experiencing ever increasing growing pains due to the JJ number of websites and projects we represent . So we have just installed donation buttons on our websites and ask that you consider this when you visit them . Nothing is too JJ . text: Sometimes when you 're reading Neal Stephenson , he does n't just seem IN CD of the best novelists writing in English RB now ; he seems IN the only NN . No other author embeds characters in an authentically contemporary Web of technological connections the NN Stephenson does . His characters text and tweet and play massively multiplayer games . When they check their e-mail , they do it on their phones , not their computers ; when they make phone calls , they do it on their computers via Skype , not their phones . You can VB why other writers let this stuff slide . You have to come up with JJ kinds of stories in a networked NN . The usual missed connections and mistaken identities do n't cut it  how JJ Shakespearean tragedies MD have been averted with GPS and NNP ? Not that we do n't have problems now , NNP knows , but when you take our modern technological predicament seriously , you realize that those old problems have to be rerouted , and that the stories have to VB shape accordingly . They start to become less about missed connections and more about overconnectedness . They start to look IN Reamde . Reamde is Stephenson 's 10th novel ( not counting his occasional collaborations and the unclassifiable JJ fiction project The Mongoliad ) , and he has yet to write an uninteresting NN . In Reamde we find him slimming down to middleweight after five straight heavyweight bouts : the cryptographical epic Cryptonomicon , the 2,500 - page three - novel Baroque Cycle and then Anathem , a philosophical novel set on an alt - universe NN where monasteries are consecrated to higher mathematics . Stephenson 's abiding preoccupation is NN flow , and how NN shapes the lives of the NNS RB and through whom it flows . He is generally tagged as a NN - fiction novelist , but that categorization is difficult to support on the NN  the Baroque Cycle was set in the 17th and 18th centuries and stuck to existing history , more or less . ( Isaac Newton is a major character ; the NN turns on his little - VBN role as Master of the Mint . ) " NN fiction " describes Stephenson 's interests , but not his methods . While recognizably Stephensonian , Reamde is less about the flow of NN through JJ networks than it is about the flow of bullets out of guns . This is , RB and foremost , a Bourne - style international thriller , and as such its intellectual sites are set lower than those of its immediate predecessors . The hero of Reamde is  or at JJ appears to be  Richard Forthrast , founder of a NNP of Warcraftesque massively multiplayer fantasy game called T'Rain . Richard is an amiable enough guy in his 50s , living in Seattle , with NN too much NN and NN too little in the NN of emotional or , for that matter , physical connections to the NN IN him . This VBZ when he hires his niece Zula , an Eritrean refugee adopted by his sister , and takes a mentor 's interest in her . Zula is a crack programmer but not , it turns out , a crack picker of boyfriends . Hers sells stolen NN to some Russian gangsters , and the deal goes south when a NN from T'Rain called Reamde  the intentional typo stops bothering you after a while , though it does n't VB easier to pronounce  encrypts the NNS . The gangsters promptly kidnap the boyfriend and Zula and head off in search of the NN writer , who 's got an IP address in NNP , specifically in the city of Xiamen . At this point Zula takes over as the story 's focus . She 's press - ganged into a pack of captive hackers and soldiers of fortune who pursue JJ the NN writers and then , as the narrative upshifts , a bin Ladenesque Islamic terrorist . ( The NN of focus is a bit jarring . But it 's a JJ story  Reamde clocks in at over 1,000 pages . ) The pace of Reamde is rapid and unwavering  the plot automatically extrudes twists , JJ settings and RB fresh major characters at precisely calibrated intervals . The characters ping - pong IN the globe as if geography were an afterthought and communicate via a pidgin English largely VBN on NN games , which is their shared frame of reference . These are NNS who , in any earlier incarnation of JJ civilization , MD never have met CD another . But now they have , and not because they wished to , but because the logic of NN and NN requires it , and because the now JJ , frictionless NN no longer has the NN to keep them apart . But the story of Reamde is mostly there as a superstructure for Stephenson 's observations about how the NN IN us actually works  the background is the foreground . There 's a marvelous sequence late in the book when the characters become transfixed by what 's happening on a computer , and Stephenson , without pausing or RB slowing down the NN , weaves in a concise explanation of how a computer monitor works and why it looks the NN it does . You do n't bog down in it  the explanation is the NN and the moment feels real , because we understand not just what 's happening but RB why and how , down to the submolecular level . This realness serves Stephenson 's themes well : he likes to play with the sharp sheer between the NN as it is and how it appears in the cartoon looking glass of pop culture . Asked why the Russian criminals VBP he and Zula can find the author of Reamde , a no-nonsense Hungarian programmer replies , " Because we are hackers , and they have seen movies . " The joke of watching a bunch of NN - game addicts VBP caught up in actual shootouts never gets old : RB in the middle of a finely turned Mexican standoff on a dock in Xiamen , the terrorist delivers a lecture on the eccentricities of the firing mechanism of the Makarov pistol that his opponent is holding against his head . In Stephenson 's NN , victory generally goes to the guy who 's read the manual . If there is an overarching theme to Reamde , it 's the importance of drilling down through easy bull ---- explanations to the tough , complicated substrate of the real NN beneath  the importance of not satisfying yourself with the vague approximations of NN games and , for that matter , sub -Stephensonian writers . text: What is Term Structure Of Interest Rates ? Term structure of interest rates , commonly VBN as the yield curve , depicts the interest rates of similar quality bonds at JJ maturities . Essentially , term structure of interest rates is the relationship between interest rates or bond yields and JJ terms or maturities . When graphed , the term structure of interest rates is VBN as a yield curve , and it plays a crucial role in identifying the current NN of an economy . The term structure of interest rates reflects expectations of NN participants about future NNS in interest rates and their assessment of monetary policy conditions . In general terms , yields increase in line with maturity , giving rise to an upward - sloping , or normal , yield curve . The yield curve is primarily VBN to illustrate the term structure of interest rates for standard U.S. NN - issued securities . This is important as it is a gauge of the debt NN 's feeling about NN . The most frequently reported yield curve compares the three - month , CD - NN , five - NN , CD - NN , and 30 - NN U.S. Treasury debt . ( Yield curve rates are usually available at the Treasury 's interest rate web sites by 6:00 p.m. NN each trading day ) , The term of the structure of interest rates has three primary shapes . • Upward sloping — JJ term yields are higher than short term yields . This is considered to be the " normal " slope of the yield curve and signals that the economy is in an expansionary mode . • Downward sloping — short term yields are higher than JJ term yields . Dubbed as an " inverted " yield curve and signifies that the economy is in , or about to enter , a recessive period . • JJ — very little variation between short and JJ term yields . Signals that the NN is unsure about the future direction of the economy . This yield curve is considered the benchmark for the credit NN , as it reports the yields of NN - free fixed income investments across a range of maturities . In the credit NN , banks and lenders use this benchmark as a gauge for determining lending and savings rates . Yields along the U.S. Treasury yield curve are primarily influenced by the Federal Reserve ’s federal funds rate . Other yield curves can RB be developed VBN upon a comparison of credit investments with similar NN characteristics . Most often , the Treasury yield curve is upward - sloping . CD basic explanation for this phenomenon is that investors demand higher interest rates for longer - term investments as compensation for investing their NN in longer - duration investments . Occasionally , JJ - term yields MD fall below short - term yields , creating an inverted yield curve that is generally regarded as a harbinger of recession . The Outlook for the Overall Credit NN The term structure of interest rates and the direction of the yield curve can be VBN to judge the overall credit NN environment . A flattening of the yield curve means longer - term rates are falling in comparison to short - term rates , which MD have implications for a recession . When short - term rates begin to exceed JJ - term rates , the yield curve is inverted , and a recession is likely occurring or approaching . When longer - term rates fall below shorter - term rates , the outlook for credit over the JJ term is weak . This is often consistent with a weak or recessionary economy , which is defined by CD consecutive periods of negative growth in the gross domestic product ( GDP ) . While other factors , including foreign demand for U.S. Treasuries , can RB result in an inverted yield curve , historically , an inverted yield curve has been an indicator of an impending recession in the NNP NNPS .

text: Murray and Riccardelli are NN specialists who were returning to NNP Jersey from a vacation in Paris when their plane was diverted to Gander . " Our stay in Gander , once we got over the shock and once we settled into the College of the North Atlantic where we were staying . It was very pleasant , and very accommodating ... we MD just not VB how good the NNS were in that town and how they just rallied and they brought in food . The culinary students cooked for us , you VBP , every meal . Our JJ thought when we got off the plane and we saw the school buses coming in and we learned later they had come off strike to actually VB carry us to whereever we had to VB . And we thought we were VBG to be sleeping on a floor somewhere , eating Doritos from the local mini-mart we had no idea what was VBG to happen . And here everyone brought in food , bed linens , you VBP , mattresses from the Walmart . It was overwhelming . " Maureen and Sue have formed a close bond with Mac and Nellie Moss - Mac Moss was the head of the College of the North Atlantic at the NN , and CD other couples . They 've been back to visit a number of times . Mac and Nellie Moss visited them in NNP Jersey where they took them to Ground Zero . " It 's been a continuous almost family - JJ relationship where we email each other , we send Christmas cards , we 're always in touch ... I VBP we just have this bond over what happened . We VBD out that the mayor of our town [ Morris Plains , NNP Jersey ] he met them [ Mac and Nellie Moss ] when they came over , and we 're VBG to have a twinning of our cities they call it , and exchange flags and banners and sort of promote each others towns , and I VBP they 're considering taking our town logo , which is the ' Community of Caring ' and just creating this relationship between our CD towns . " " We 've become ambassadors , I VBP ... And you VBP we have VBN our story over and over again and NNS never ceased to be amazed and they VBP to hear more when we talk about it . And when I meet someone on business or a JJ person and ... if the subject of 9/11 comes up and ' Where were you ? ' , I always have the most rivetting story because this is the only bright spot in that day . This is the only goodness that anyone can RB find . It 's kind of amazing . We 've VBN we saw the darkest side of humanity and the brightest side of humanity on the same day . " Photo Gallery and thoughts from Susan Riccardelli and Maureen Murray " September 11 , 2001 began what you might call our " love affair " with Newfoundland . In five visits since our unexpected trip in 2001 , we 've been back in 2002 , 2004 , 2006 and 2008 . Each NN we visit with our Pond Six friends - three dear couples who live on Little Cobb's Pond . Perhaps on this next trip we 'll try Seal Flipper Pie . There are so JJ other places in the NN to visit but we keep heading back to Newfoundland . Their homes are our homes . "
